content.content: 牛乳に浸したパン
bread soaked in milk

I earnestly entreated him.

He is intent on his studies―absorbed in his studies.

She is doing well after childbirth―doing poorly after childbirth.

ひたばしり〔直走り〕
〈名〉Running at full tilt

content.content: 彼はひた走りに走って来た
He came running at the top of his speed―running as fast as his legs could carry him.

content:
ひだり〔左〕
〈名、形〉
1. The left

content.content: 左の手
the left hand
彼は主人の左に坐っている
He sits on the left of his master.
僕の左にいたのは田中だ
The man on my left was Tanaka.
道路の左に立派な門がある
There is a gate―(左側なら)―on the left of the road―(左方に当たってなら)―(to the) left of the road.
左へ曲る
to turn to the left―take a turning on the left
左向け左
Left turn!
左にならへ
Eyes left!―Left dress!
右の耳から入って左の耳から出てしまう
“Go in at one ear, come out at the other.”
あの人は左が利く
He is fond of drink―a thirsty soul.
右から左へ
easily―with ease
大金のことだから右から左へというわけにはいかない
I can't have such a large sum ready so easily.

content:
ひだりうちわで〔左団扇で〕
〈副〉With a fan in one's left hand

content.content: 左団扇で暮らす
to live in ease and luxury―live in clover―(殊に―with one's daughter living a life of shame)―batten on one's daughter's shame
娘に嫁がせて親達は左団扇で暮らしている
While the daughter lives a life of shame, the parents live in clover―The parents batten on their daughter's shame.

content:
ひだりがわ〔左側〕
〈名〉The left-hand side

content.content: 道路の左側に
on the left-hand side of the road―on the left of the road
左側を歩行すべし
Keep to the left.

content:
ひだりきき〔左利き〕
〈名〉A left-handed person; a left-hander:(=の) left-handed

content.content: 左利きは器用
Left-handed people are clever.

content.content: ひだりきき〔左利き〕

content.content: 左づまをとる
to be a geisha―follow a gay profession

content:
ぴたりと〔ピタリと〕
〈副〉Close

content.content: 上衣がピタリと合う
The coat fits you close―fits you to a nicety―fits you to a T.
ピタリと身に着く上衣
a close-fitting coat

content:
ぴたりと〔ピタリと〕
〈副〉Close

content.content: 上衣がピタリと合う
The coat fits you close―fits you to a nicety―fits you to a T.
ピタリと身に着く上衣
a close-fitting coat

content:
ひだりまえ〔左前〕
〈副〉

content.content: 左前に着物を着る
to wear one's coat with the left side under the right―the wrong way
なにもかも左前
Everything goes wrong.
身上が左前になる
to get into Queer street
あの家は左前になってきた
The house is getting into Queer street.

content:
ひたる〔浸る〕
〈自動〉To soak (in the water); to be soaked (in water); to be steeped (in liquor); to be flooded (with water); to be submerged (in water); to wallow (in mud, etc.)

content.content: 洪水で田畑が水に浸った
The fields are flooded with water―covered with water―submerged in water―under water.
甲板が水に浸っている
The deck is awash.
なんぼ海水浴でも一日水に浸っていては毒だ
Sea-bathing is all very well, but it will do you harm to soak in the water all day.
彼は酒に浸っている
He is steeped in liquor―drowned in wine.
一日朝から晩まで酒に浸っている
He boozes all day―soaks from morning till night.
豚は汚物に浸っていることが好きだ
Pigs like to wallow in filth.

ひだるい
〈形〉(To be) hungry, faint with hunger

〈名〉Grief; sorrow; lamentation:(=する) to grieve, sorrow (at the sight or news―over one's death); to lament, bewail (one's death)

content.content: 悲歎に暮れる
to abandon oneself to grief―break one's heart
一家悲歎に暮れている
The family are sunk in grief―plunged in grief―broken-hearted―heart-broken.

〈名〉A torrent; rapids

content.content: 南洲美談
the Noble Deeds of Saigo Takamori

Episodes of the Great War.

content.content: びなんし〔美男子〕

content.content: 治者と被治者の関係
the relation between ruler and ruled

content.content: 波がピチャピチャ岸へ寄せる
The sea laps the beach.

content:
びちゅう〔微衷〕
〈名〉One's true heart; one's inmost thoughts

content.content: 微衷を語る(心底を打明ける)
to reveal one's inmost thoughts (to another)

content:
ひちょう〔飛鳥〕
〈名〉A flying bird; a bird on the wing

content.content: 飛鳥射撃
a wing shot
飛鳥を撃つ
to shoot flying
本は飛鳥の如く売れる
The book sells like wildfire―There is s rush for the book―There is a rush on the book.

〈自動〉→『

content.content: ひきかえす〔引返す〕

content:
ひっかえる〔引換える〕
〈他動〉→『

content.content: ひきかえ〔引換え〕

content:
ひっかかる〔引掛かる〕
〈自動〉
1. To catch, be caught (in or on something); to run foul of (a rope); (a pen) scratches

content.content: 凧が木にひっかかった
The kite caught―got caught―in a tree.
着物が釘にひっかかたっ
My clothes caught on a nail―A nail caught my clothes―A nail caught in my clothes.
この錠前はどこかひっかかって利かない
The lock catches somewhere, and will not work.
縄と縄とひっかかって動かない
The ropes have run foul of each other.
このペンはひっかかって書けない
I can't write with this pen, it scratches so.
喉に骨がひっかかった
A bone sticks in my throat.
彼は悪い女にひっかかった
He has become entangled with―fallen into the clutches of―a bad woman.

content:
ひっかきまわす〔引掻き廻す〕
〈他動〉
1. To ransack (a drawer); to rummage (a drawer―in a drawer―among the papers); to throw (things) into confusion; to make hay of (things)

content.content: 抽斗をひっかきまわしてやっとあった
I ransacked the drawer―rummaged in the drawer―and found it at last.
私の物をひっかきまわしちゃいやよ
You are making hay of my things.

content: 2. (=勝手に処置する)to tamper with (things); to carry matters with a high hand

content.content: 細君が一人で家の中をひっかきまわしている
She carries matters with a high hand.
あの先生は学校の中をひっかきまわそうとするから嫌われるのだ
He is disliked, because he tries to tamper with school affairs.
あんな奴にひっかきまわされてたまるものか
We won't stand having things tampered with by such a fellow.

content:
ひっかく〔引掻く〕
〈他動〉To scratch

content.content: 猿に顔をひっかかれた
The monkey has scratched my face.

content:
ひっかける〔引掛ける〕
〈他動〉
1. To hang (anything on a nail); to catch, seize (with a hook); to hook, gaff (a fish)

content.content: 上衣を脱いで木の枝にひっかけた
I took off my coat, and hung it on a branch.
彼は鳶口で逃げる奴の着物へ引っかけた
He caught the clothes of the flying form with a fireman's hook.
魚を鉤でひっかける
to gaff a fish
僕は着物を釘にひっかけた
I caught my clothes on a nail―My clothes caught on a nail―A nail caught my clothes―A nail caught in my clothes.
喉へ骨をひっかけた
I have a bone sticking in my throat―A bone sticks in my throat.
外套をひっかける
to throw on―slip on―shuffle on―an overcoat
一杯ひっかける
to toss off a glass―toss down the liquor
唾をひっかける
to spit at a man
女をひっかける
to form a connection with―form a liaison with―a woman
借金をひっかける
to bilk a bill―evade payment
彼は商人をひっかけるくらい何とも思わぬ
He makes nothing of bilking a tradesman.

content:
ひっかぶる〔引被る〕
〈他動〉
1. To draw (anything) over one's head

content.content: 彼は雷が鳴ると蒲団をひっかぶる
When it begins to thunder, he will pull his bedclothes over his head.
一杯ひっかぶる
to drain a glass―toss off a glass
人の罪をひっかぶる
to bear another's blame

content:
ひっき〔筆記〕
〈名〉Notes:(=する) to take notes of a (speech); to note down, write down, take down, jot down (anything for future reference)

content.content: 君は講義を筆記するか
Do you take notes of the lectures?
演説筆記
a report of a speech
筆記帳
a note-book
筆記試験
a written examination

ひつき〔火付き〕

content.content: この木は火付きが好い、火つきが悪い

content:
ひつぎ〔日嗣〕
〈名〉The Imperial throne

content.content: 日嗣の御子
the Prince Imperial―the Crown Prince

ひっきしけん〔筆記試験〕
〈名〉A written examination

content:
ひっきょう〔畢竟〕
〈名〉After all; in fine; in short

content.content: 震死は畢竟幸福な死に方だ
One who is struck dead by lightning, dies a happy death, after all.
畢竟身分不相応のぜいたくから悪事を為すのだ
In fine, they commit crimes by living above their means.
畢竟働かないで金を取ろうという近道をしたのが悪かったのだ
In short, he tried to get money without working for it.

content:
ひっきらず〔引切らず〕
〈副〉Continually; constantly; incessantly; unceasingly; ceaselessly; without intermission; without interruption

content.content: 昨夜子どもがひっきらず泣いた
The child cried without intermission―kept crying―all night.
あの家には朝から晩まで入り換わり立ち換わりひっきらず来客がある
They have a constant succession of company―an unceasing stream of visitors―from morning till night, at that house.
彼はひっきらず勉強している
He is continually at work―constantly at work.
彼女はひっきらずしゃべっている
She is constantly talking―She talks nineteen to the dozen.

content:
ひっきりなしに〔引切り無しに〕
〈副〉→『

content.content: ひっきらず〔引切らず〕

〈他動〉To saw off

content.content: 木の枝を挽切る
to saw off a bough

〈自他動〉To dry up; to dry to (anything)

content:
ひっくくる〔引括る〕
〈他動〉To tie (one) up; to bind (one) fast

content.content: 今度こそひっくくってやる
I will bring him to justice this time.

content:
びっくり〔吃驚〕
〈名〉A surprise:(恐怖を含めば)fright:(=する) to be surprised; to be frightened; to be startled; to start; to give a start; to have one's heart in one's mouth; to jump out of one's skin:(=させる) to surprise, frighten, startle, stagger (a person); to give (one) a turn; to give (one) a fit; to give (one) a start; to spring a surprise upon (one); to spring a mine upon (one)

content.content: びっくり仰天する
to be astonished―be astounded―be amazed
びっくりして目を丸くした
He stared in amazement.
その報に接してびっくりした
The news gave me a turn.
びっくりして立ち上がった
I started to my feet.
びっくりして目をさました
I awoke in surprise―started from my sleep.
婦人がびっくりして気絶した
She fainted from fright.
びっくりして病気を起こした
She was ill of fright―frightened into fits.
彼はびっくりして狼狽した
He was frightened out of his wits.
びっくりしてしゃっくりが止まった
The fright has stopped my hiccup.
死ぬほどびっくりした
I was frightened to death.
ぶっ倒れんばかりにびっくりした
I was struck all of a heap.
びっくりして腰を抜かした
I was so frightened that my knees gave way.
その恐ろしい光景を見てびっくりして後へ下がった
I recoiled from the horrible sight.
その質問にびっくりして二の句が出なかった
The question staggered me―The question was a staggerer.
二度びっくり
a second surprise

content:
ひっくりかえしに
〈副〉Topsyturvy; upside down; inside out; the wrong side out

content.content: 君はひっくりかえしに上衣を着ている
You are wearing your coat inside out―the wrong side out.
ひっくりかえしに本を持っている
You are holding your book upside down.

content:
ひっくりかえす
〈他動〉To overturn (anything standing); to upset (a carriage); to capsize (a boat); to turn (a plate) over; to turn over (a cake); to turn out (one's pocket); to turn (a picture); upside down; to turn (a coat) inside out; to turn (the world) topsyturvy; to invert, reverse (the order); to evert (an organ)

content.content: ランプをひっくりかえして火事になった
They overturned a lamp, which set the house on fire.
炉で焼いていた菓子を時々ひっくりかえすように女が男に頼んだ
She asked him to turn over the cakes baking over the fire from time to time.
眼瞼をひっくりかえす
to evert the eyelid

content:
ひっくりかえる
〈自動〉
1. (Anything standing) overturns; (a carriage) upsets; (a boat) capsizes, turns turtle; to turn upside down; to turn inside out; to turn topsyturvy

content.content: 額がひっくりかえっている
The picture is upside down.
袖がひっくりかえっている
The sleeve is inside out.
小舟がひっくりかえって浮かんできた
A boat came floating bottom upwards―keel upwards.
そんなことをしたら世の中がひっくりかえってしまう
Then the world would be turned topsyturvy.
家の中は上を下へとひっくりかえるような騒ぎ
The whole house was being turned upside down―being turned topsyturvy.

content: 2. (=仰に臥す)to lie down on one's back

content.content: 座敷の真中にひっくりかえっている
He is lying on his back in the middle of the room.

びっくりばこ〔びっくり箱〕
〈名〉A jack-in-the-box

content:
ひっくるめる
〈他動〉To lump, mass (many items together―one thing with the others)

content.content: 皆ひっくるめていくらと見積る
They are valued in the lump―in the gross―en masse.
皆ひっくるめていくらか
What do you ask all together?
ひっくるめて言えば
To be short,―To be brief,...

content:

content.content: 火つけをする

content:
ひづけ〔日付け〕
〈名〉A date

content.content: 手紙に日付けをする
to date a letter
日付けの無い手紙
an undated letter
手紙の日付けは三月三日ロンドンとしてある
The letter is dated―The letter bears the date of―London, March 3rd.
先月十日の日付けの手紙
a letter dated the tenth ult.―under date of the 10th ult.

content:

〈形〉Indispensable

content.content: 学生必携の良書

content: 〈名〉A vade-mecum; a handbook; a manual

content.content: 硯筆に親む
to follow literary pursuits―be engaged in literary work

content:
びっこ〔跛〕
〈形〉Lame (of one leg); halt:(物に用いれば)uneven

content.content: びっこ引く
to limp―halt―dot and go one
びっこ引いて歩く
to limp along―halt along
びっこになる
to go lame―fall lame
この卓はびっこだ
The table has uneven legs.

ひっこう〔筆耕〕
〈名〉(事)copying (for hire):(人)a copyist; an amanuensis

content:
ひっこし〔引越し〕
〈名〉A removal; a flit; change of abode:(=する) to remove; to move; to flit; to change quarters; to move house

content.content: いつお引越しですか
When are you going to move?―going to remove?
お引越しのお手伝いしましょう
I will help you carry your things.
三度引越しすると火事に逢ったも同然だ(と西洋で言う)
“Three removals are as bad as a fire.”
引越蕎麦
buckwheat-vermicelli distributed to announce one's removal into the neighbourhood
引越荷車あり
Removal vans provided.

content:
ひっこす〔引越す〕
〈自動〉To remove (to another place); to move (into the neighbourhood); to flit; to change quarters; to move house

content.content: 彼はどこかへ引越して行ってしまった
He has removed somewhere―removed God knows where.
麻布の方へ引越して行った
He has removed to Azabu―removed up Azabu way.
ご近処へ引越して来ました
I have moved into your neighbourhood.
お隣へ引越して来ました
I have moved next-door to your house―become your next-door neighbour.
明日新宅へ引越します
We move into the new house tomorrow.
明日は荷物を引まとめて引越して来ます
I shall move here bag and baggage tomorrow.
借りた家へ引越す
to enter into possession of the house

content:
ひっこぬく〔ヒッコ抜く〕
〈他動〉→『

content.content: ひきぬく〔引抜く〕

content:
ひっこます〔引込ます〕
〈他動〉To draw in (one's legs); to take in (the flag); to retract (its horns); to withdraw (what one has offered)

content.content: 目をひっこまして焼餅を焼いている
She is consumed with jealousy.

content:
ひっこませる〔引込ませる〕
〈他動〉To draw in (one's legs); to take in (the flag); to retract (its horns); to withdraw (what one has offered)

content.content: 亀が首をひっこませる
A tortoise draws its head in―draws its head into the shell.
蝸牛が角をひっこませる
A snail draws in its horns―retracts its horns.
猫が爪をひっこませる
A cat draws in her claws.
足をひっこませる
to draw in one's legs
手をひっこませる
to draw back one's hand
仕事が骨が折れるから手をひっこませる人が多い
Most people shrink from the task.
旗をひっこませる
to take in the flag
ランプの心が出過ぎているから少しひっこませよ
The lamp-wick is too high. Turn it down a little.
弥次が弁士をひっこました
The mob jeered down―hissed down―the speaker.
幽霊をひっこませる
to lay the ghost
いたっん出したものをひっこませることはできない
I can not withdraw what I have once offered you.

content:
ひっこみ〔引込み〕
〈名〉Retirement; withdrawal

content.content: そうなるとひっこみがつかなくなる
Then one can not retire with a good grace―withdraw with a good grace.

content:
ひっこみがち〔引込み勝〕
〈形〉Retired (person)

content.content: あの人はひっこみがちだ
He is a retired man―He is of a retiring disposition.

content:
ひっこみじあん〔引込思案〕
〈名〉Conservative policy; over-prudence

content.content: 日本人はひっこみ思案が多い
Most Japanese are over-prudent―conservative.

content:
ひっこむ〔引込む〕
〈自動〉
1. To go in; to come in; to fall back; to retire; to withdraw; to recede; to disappear

content.content: 少しひっこめ
Fall back a little!
痣がひっこんだ
The bruise has disappeared.
鼠が穴から出たりひっこんだり
The mice now come out, and now go in.
皆銘々の室へひっこんでしまった
They had all disappeared into their several rooms.
田舎へひっこむ
to retire into the country
僕は田舎へひっこもうかと思う
I think of retiring into the provinces.
田舎へひっこんじゃつまらない
You can do no good by burying yourself in the provinces.
彼はいつもひっこんでいる
He leads a retired life.
久しくひっこんでいるから世間の事情に疎くなっている
He has lived a retired life so long that he is out of touch with the times.
僕は近頃は内にひっこんでいる
I keep indoors these days.
雨が降るから内にひっこんでいる
The rain keeps me indoors.
彼は内にひっこんでくすぶってばかりいる
He always cowers at home―sticks indoors.
彼は恥ずかしがってひっこんでいる
He is ashamed to show his face.

a hollow-eyed man

content:

〈自動〉
1. To be set off (to advantage); to look to advantage; to show well; to contrast with (its surroundings); to gain by contrast; to be relieved against (the background); to stand out (conspicuously)

content.content: 君は洋服が引き立つ
Foreign clothes set you off to advantage.
色の白い人は黒か紺が引き立つ
A dark colour sets off a white complexion to advantage.
額縁で絵が引き立つ
The frame sets off the picture.
日本人は羽織袴が引き立つ
A Japanese looks to advantage―looks to the best advantage―in haori and hakama.
日本婦人は洋服か引き立たない
Japanese ladies do not look to advantage―cut a poor figure―in foreign dress.
紺地に金モールは引き立つ
Gold-lace shows well on blue.
彼女の器量が分けて引き立つ
Her beauty stands out conspicuously.
建物は周囲と対照して引き立つ
The building contrasts finely with its surroundings―forms a fine contrast to its surroundings―gains by contrast with its surroundings.
新築は暗い鎮守の森を背景に引き立つ
The new building is finely relieved against the dark sacred grove.
白帆が暗い沖を背景に引き立つ
The white sails are clearly relieved against―clearly defined against―sharply outlined against―beautifully contrasted with―the dark horizon.
歴史家の筆で偉人の人格が十分に引き立つ
The historian's pen brings out in full relief the great man's character.
その言行が麗々と引き立つ
His actions and saying stand out in bold relief.
場面が引き立つ
The scene is enlivened―The scene becomes lively.
今日は気が引き立たない
I am in low spirits―out of sorts―I feel depressed today.
彼は引き立たない性質だ

ひつめつ〔必滅〕

content.content: 生者必滅
