content:
ひつよう〔必要〕
〈名〉Necessity (for money); need (of money); want (of a book); importance (of system); occasion (for haste); call (for luxury):(緊急の必要)Urgency; pressure:(刻下の必要)emergency; exigency

content.content: 必要は発明を生む
“Necessity is the mother of invention.”
当分金の必要は無い
I have no need of money―There is no necessity for money―for the present.
急ぐ必要は無い
There is no occasion for haste.
僕は贅沢品の必要は無い
I have no call for luxuries.
天下を知るに門を出る必要は無い
There is not need of going abroad to know the world.
必要の場合には金を借りてもさしつかえない
You may borrow money in case of necessity―if necessary―if need be.
必要の場合に借りた金だ
The money was borrowed under circumstances of necessity―when necessary.
必要あらば働く
I will work if necessary―if need be.
必要次第に
according to the need―according to the urgency of the case
必要次第に金額を決める
The amount will be decided upon according to the urgency of the case―as the urgency of the case may demand―(他動詞構文にすれば)―The urgency of the case will determine the amount.
必要を感ずる
to feel a need―feel a want
良い字書の必要は痛切に感じられる
The want of a good dictionary is keenly felt.
必要に応ずる
to meet a need―meet a want
痛切に感じた必要に応じてできた本は概して良書である
That book is generally a good one which is written to meet a keenly felt want―to meet a pressing need.
刻下の必要に応ずる
to meet an emergency―meet the exigencies of the times
英国は刻下の必要に応じて徴兵制度を採用した
England adopted the conscription system to meet an emergency―to meet the exigencies of the moment.
刻下の必要に応じて兵員を増減する
The number of troops may be increased or decreased according to the exigencies of the times―as the exigencies of the time may demand.
必要に迫る
to be pressed by necessity
緊急の必要に迫ってこしらえた法律
The law was made under the pressure of necessity―under pressure.
人は必要に迫って働く
People work under the pressure of necessity.
必要に迫らなければ働かぬ
They do not work unless they are pressed by necessity―except under the pressure of necessity.
必要に迫って借りた金だ
The money was borrowed under the pressure of necessity.
不時の必要に備える
to provide against a possible need―provide against emergencies
万一の必要に備えるために貯金する
A fund is deposited to provide against emergencies.
何の必要を説く
to urge the necessity of―insist upon―something
先生は系統的研究の必要を説かれる
He urges (upon us) the necessity of systematic study―impresses upon us the importance of systematic study.
また時間の経済の必要を説かれる
He also insists upon the economy of time.
そうすれば金の必要は無くなる
Then I shall have no need of money―there will be no necessity for money.
彼は働いて飯を食う必要が無くなった(必要を脱した)
He has risen above the necessity of―He is raised above the necessity of―working for his bread.
金持ちになれば働く必要は無くなる
It you become rich, you will rise above the necessity of labour―(他動詞構文にすれば)―Wealth will raise you above the necessity of labour.
英語の必要は年と共に加わる
The knowledge of English becomes more and more important every year.

content: 〈形〉Necessary, needful, needed (for the purpose to the result―to the person―for some one to do something); important (for the purpose―to the person):(資格として必要)requisite (to a teacher):(要素として必要)essential (to happiness):(必要欠くべからず)not to be dispensed with; indispensable (to success):(免るべからざる必要)imperative (on some one to do something)

content.content: 僕は洋行したいけれども必要な資金が無い
I wish to go abroad, but I want the means necessary for the purpose―the necessary means.
戦争をするには金が必要だ
Money is necessary for war―(他動詞構文にすれば)―War necessitates money―Money is the sinews of war.
睡眠は健康に必要である
Sleep is necessary to health.
英語は誰にでも必要だ
The knowledge of English is important to everybody.
一日二時間の運動は身体に必要だ
Two hours a day's exercise is necessary to health.
健康は幸福の必要分子である
Health is essential to health.
いわゆる慈善なるものは道徳の必要分子ではない
The so-called charity is not essential to morality.
練習は語学に必要欠くべからず
Practice is indispensable to language-study―Practice is not to be dispensed with in language-study.
忍耐は成功には必要にして欠くべかず
Perseverance is essential to success.
彼は教師たるものに必要な知識を欠いている
He is wanting in that knowledge which is requisite to a teacher.
彼は王侯たるものに必要な仁徳を欠いている
He is wanting in the virtues requisite to a ruler of men.
彼は人に将たるものに必要な智勇を欠いている
He is wanting in the wisdom and valour requisite to a commander.
この金は絶対的に必要だ
The money is absolutely necessary to me―It is absolutely necessary that I should have the money.
島国には何はさておき海軍が必要である
It is imperative on an island empire to have a navy.
必要な金は誰が出すか
Who will provide the necessary (money)?
必要な資金はどうして金策するか
How will you find the necessary (means)?
まずもって必要な手続きをふまねばならぬ
We must first take the necessary (steps)―do the necessary (things).
必要以上の金がある
There is more money than is needed.
生活の必要品
the necessaries of life
それを為す必要は無い
It is unnecessary―needless―to do it.

content: 〈代用助動詞〉Must:(打消せば)need out

content.content: 彼にも聞かしておく必要がある
We must tell him―He must know it.
彼にも秘密を明かしておく必要がある
We must let him into the secret―He must be let into the secret.
この金は返済する必要は無い
You need not repay the money.
急ぐ必要は無い
You need not hurry.
天下を知るに門を出る必要はない
One need not go abroad to know the world.
何もはばかる必要はあるまい
Why need I fear?―Why should I fear?
何も謝る必要はあるまい
Why need I apologize?―Why should I apologize?

content: 〈代用動詞〉Can not spare; can not do without; can not dispense with ［注意］“Can spare”(=can do without)「無くてすむ」「無しにすます」を打消せば“can not spare”(=can not do without)「無くてはすまぬ」となるをもって「必要」に代用するのである、而して簡易な語を好む英米人は談話中“necessary”なる発音しにくい語を避けて“can't spare”を用い、“unnecessary”の代わりに“can do without”を用いるのである。

content.content: あの人は必要だから手放せぬ
I can't spare that man.
この金は必要だから貸すわけには行かぬ
I can't spare this money.
この金は当分必要が無い
I can do without this money for the present.
あの人は学校に必要は無い(いなくとも結構間に合う)
We can do very well without him―He can be very well done without.
練習は語学に必要欠くべからず
We can not dispense with practice in language-study.

content:
ひつようひん〔必要品〕
〈名〉A necessary

content.content: 生活の必要品
the necessaries of life
彼らはぜいたく品はさておいてぜひ無くてならぬ必要品にも困っている
They want the bare necessaries of life, to say nothing of luxuries.

content:
ひつりょく〔筆力〕
〈名〉
1. (=筆勢)the boldness of the strokes

content.content: 筆力生けるが如し
His bold strokes are instinct with life.

content: 2. (=筆の力)the power of one's pen

content.content: 筆力をふるう
to wield one's powerful pen
筆力を試す
to try one's pen

content:
ひてい〔否定〕
〈名〉Denial; negation:(=する) to negative, deny, gainsay (a fact)

content.content: この事実は否定し難し
There is no denying the fact―The fact is undeniable.
否定語
a negative
否定文
a negative sentence
否定命題
a negative proposition

ひていきせん〔非定期船〕
〈名〉An ocean tramp

content:
ひでり〔旱〕
〈名〉Drought

content.content: 今年は旱だ
We have a drought―There is a drought―this year.
旱に不作無し
“Drought never brought dearth.”

content:
ひでん〔秘伝〕
〈名〉A professional secret; the mysteries of trade; a recipe

content.content: 秘伝を伝える
to initiate one into the mysteries of a trade
秘伝の妙薬
a proprietary medicine

content:
びてん〔美点〕
〈名〉A beauty (beauties); a charm (charms)

content.content: 沙翁{しゃおう=シェークスピア}の美点を数える
to enumerate the beauties of Shakespeare

content:
びでん〔美田〕
〈名〉Broad acres

content.content: 子孫の為に美田を買わず
I will not leave broad acres to my posterity.

content:
ひでんか〔妃殿下〕
〈名〉Her Imperial Highness the Princess

content.content: 皇太子妃殿下
Her Imperial Highness the Crown Princess.

content:
ひと〔一と〕
〈接頭詞〉One; a

content.content: ひと足
a step
ひと目
one glance

content:
ひと〔人〕
〈名〉
1. (最も広き意味にては無冠詞単数)man

content.content: 人は神の形像なり
Man is the image of God.
人は万物の霊長なり
“Man is lord of the creation.”
事を図るは人に在り、事を為すは天に在り
“Man proposes, God disposes.”
人は額に汗して世を送る
“Man must live by the sweat of his brow.”
人は必勝を期すべからず
“It is not in man to command success.”
人は誤りがち
Man is liable to error.
人は木石にあらず
Man is made of flesh and blood.
人の人たる所以実にここに在す
This makes man what he is.

content: 2. (=一般の人)a man; men

content.content: 人死して名を残す
A man leaves a name behind him.
人は一代名は末代
A man must die, but his name may live for ever.
花は桜木人は武士
The cherry among flowers, the samurai among men.
人の善悪はその交る友を見て知れ
“A man is known by the company he keeps.”
人は見かけによらぬもの
“Do not judge of a man by his looks.”
人は各々得手不得手あり
Each man has his limitations.
人は好き好き
Every man to his taste.
歳月人を待たず
“Time and tide wait for no man.”
人定りて天に勝つ
A man, when resolved, may force the event.
人衆くして天に勝つ
Men, when united, may alter their destiny.

content: 3. (=物に対する人)a person; a man

content.content: 人と物
a person or thing―men and things
人と物に処す(世を処す)
to deal with men and things
法律は人を論ぜず
The law has no respect of persons―The law is no respecter of persons.

content: 4. (=どんな人)(what sort of) a man; (no common) being; (pitiful) creature; (ordinary) mortal; (mean) fellow; (choice) spirit; (thirsty) soul

content.content: 今度の校長はどんな人か
What sort of a man is the principal?―What is the new principal like?
善さそうな人だ
He is a good sort of a man.
善い人だ
He is a good man―an excellent man―(女に言わせると)―a nice man.
偉い人だ
He is a great man.
非凡な人だ
He is no common being.
憐むべき人だ
He is a pitiful creature.
愛すべき人だ
He is a lovable creature.
平凡な人だ
He is an ordinary mortal.
二人は気の合った人だ
They are congenial spirits.
あの人は酒が好きだ
He is a thirsty soul.
彼は嘘をつくような人でない
He is not the man to tell a lie―He is above telling a lie.

content: 5. (=どこの人)who?

content.content: あれはどこの人か
Where does he come from?―Who is he?
よその人だ
He is a stranger―a strange gentleman.
あれは仙台の人だ
He is a Sendai man―He comes from Sendai.
もはやこの世の人でない
He is no longer of this world―He is no more.

content: 6. (=何をする人)what man?

content.content: あれは何をする人か
What does he do?―What is he?
絵を書く人
He is a painter.
英語を教える人
He is an English teacher.

content: 7. (=他人)another; others

content.content: この家は人のものだ(借家)
This is not my own house.
この金は人のものだ
This money is not my own.
彼は人の物を遠慮無く使う
He is free with others' possessions.
人は何と言おうとも僕はするだけのことはする
Whatever others my say, I will do my duty.
己の欲するところを人にもこれを施せ
“Do to others as you would have others do to you”―“Do to others as you would be done by.”
己をもって人をはかるな
Do not judge of others by yourself.
我が身をつねって人の痛さを知れ
Judge of other's feelings by your own.
人の長所を見るは偉人
It is a sign of greatness to see the good in others.
人の病気を頭痛に病む
to worry over other's affairs
人の振りを見て我が振りを直せ
Correct your manners by seeing others' faults.
人の宝を数えるな
Do not covet others' possessions.
人に言うな
Do not tell any one.
人は人、我は我
“Live and let live.”

content: 8. (=世人)people; men

content.content: 世の人は名利に奔走する
People toil for health or fame.
人の口に戸が立てられぬ
People will talk.
この犬は人に吠える
This dog barks at people.
春は人が出る
People turn out in spring.
天に口無し人をもって言わしむ
“The voice of the people is the voice of God.”
彼らは人を人とも思わぬ(人を人嗅いとも思わぬ)
They make nothing of people.
彼は人をそらさない
He manages to keep on terms with people.

content: 9. (=有為の人物、人才)able men; competent men; efficient men; good men; true men; talent

content.content: 日本の政界には人が無い
The political world of Japan is wanting in able men.
教育界に人が無い
The educational world is lacking in talent―There is a dearth of good teachers.
あの学校は人を出す
That school turns out good men.
教育界その人ありと知られたる誰某氏
Mr. So-and-so, who is acknowledged as an educationist.
制度はいくら好くとも運用その人を得ざれば何の効も無い
The best institutions will avail nothing if there are no efficient men to work them.
人有る中に人無し
There are many men, but few true men.
人を得るのが困難だ
It is difficult to find the right man.

content: 10. (=成人)manhood

content.content: 人に成る
to attain manhood
人中でもまれなければ人に成れぬ
One can not attain perfect manhood unless one is buffeted by the world.

content: 11. (=人物、人格)character

content.content: 彼は人を見るの明がある
He reads character―He is a good reader of character.
人を見るの明が無い
He is no reader of character―no judge of character.

content: 12. (=人影、人の姿)a form; a figure

content.content: 暗闇をすかして見ると人が二人立っていた
I peered into the darkness, and saw two forms standing.
門を出る時壁に寄りかかった人がいたと思った
When I went out at the gate, I fancied I saw a figure leaning against the wall.

content: 13. (=自分)I; a body

content.content: 人の言うことを聴かないからそんな目に逢うのだ
That comes of not minding what I say―That comes of not minding what a body says―That comes to neglecting my advice.
人をからかっちゃいやよ
You are making fun of me.
人がせっかく用意したご馳走に手もつけないとはひどいじゃないか
Isn't it too much to leave untouched a dinner I have taken all the trouble to prepare?

content: 14. (=人が好い、人が悪いの人)nature

content.content: 彼は人が好い
He is good-natured.
人が悪い
He is ill-natured―malicious.
僕は人が好いもんだから人に甘く見られて困る
People will presume upon my good nature.
君は人が好いからだまされたのだ
They have practised upon your credulity.
君は人を困らして悦んでいるのは人が悪い
It is ill-natured of you to annoy others for pleasure―You take a malicious pleasure in annoying others.
人と成る
to grow up
彼は貧困の裡に人と成った
He grew up in poverty.
彼はと英国人だけれども日本で人と成った
He is an Englishman by descent, but was born and bred in Japan.
我れ民に人と成り
I was born and bred among the people.
彼は人と成り学問を愛す
He is, by nature, a lover of knowledge.

content:
16. 
〈以下特例〉

content.content: あの島に人が住んでいるか
Is that island inhabited?
人はいない
It is uninhabited.
あの家に人がいる
That house is occupied―The house is tenanted.
人たるの道
the path of duty
人が無くて困っている
We are short of hands―short-handed.
人は病の器
“Flesh is heir to many ills.”
人を使う者はかえって使われる
The master is the servant of servants.
人は人、我は我
“Live and let live.”
人を立てる
to do due honour to one's superiors―uphold authority
黒幕となって人を操る
to pull the wires―pull the strings
人の物で義理すべをする、人の褌で相撲を取る
to rob Peter to pay Paul
天道人を殺さず
“Everything is for the best.”
情けは人の為ならず
“He who gives to the poor, lends to God.”
知る人ぞ知る
Those will appreciate who can.
人を祈らば穴二つ
“Curses come home to roost”―“Harm watch, harm catch”―“Harm set, harm, get.”
人を以て言を排せず
“If the counsel be good, it matters not who gave it.”
その罪を悪んでその人を悪まず
Detest the sin, but weep for the sinner.
ある人から聞いた
A little bird whispered to me.
人にして人に非ず
He is a brute a monster.
人の噂も七十五日
“A wonder lasts nine days.”
人の七難は見ゆれども我十難は見えず
“One can see the mote in one's brother's eye, but not the beam in one's eye.”
人を見たら盗人と思え
Do not trust strangers.
人の飯を食う
to live with strangers
あわてて人の家へ駆け込んだ
I took the wrong house in my hurry.
人には添ってみ馬には乗ってみよ
“The proof of the pudding is in the eating.”

content:
ひと〔費途〕
〈名〉An item of expenditure

content.content: 費途多端
There are many items of expenditure―There are large expenditures.

content:
ひとあし〔一と足〕
〈名〉A step

content.content: ひと足前へ出る
to take a step forward
ひと足後へ下がる
to take a step backward
ひと足ごとに水が深くなる
The water becomes deeper at every step.
停車場まではひと足だ
It is only a step to the station.
それではひと足お先に
Then you will excuse my going on before you.
ひと足早く出て来た
I started a little before the others.
君が出ると彼はひと足違いに来た
He came just after you went out.
ひと足違いで逢わなかった
I just missed meeting him.
ひと足のことで汽車に乗り損なった
I just missed the train.
ひと足遅かった
Too late!

content:
ひとあし〔人足〕
〈名〉Street traffic

content.content: 人足繁き街道
a frequented road
人足稀なる街道
an unfrequented road

ひとあわふかせる〔一と泡吹かせる〕
〈熟語〉To beat (one) into fits; to give (one) fits

content:
ひどい〔酷い〕
〈形〉
1. (=酷な)hard; harsh; bad

content.content: こんなに働かして何もくれないとはひどい、ずいぶんひどい
It's hard―It's very hard―that I must work so hard for nothing.
彼の仕打はずいぶんひどい
His conduct towards me is too bad.
わたしのことをそんなことを言うとはひどいわ
It is hard of her to say such things of me.
彼は黙って行くとはひどい
It is too bad of him―unkind of him―to leave without notice.
貴方はずいぶんひどい人ね
I am angry with you.
今度はひどい目に逢った
I have had a hard time of it―I have had a woeful experience―It has gone hard with me.
見つかるとひどい目に逢うぞ
If you are discovered, it will go hard with you.
(免職になって)ひどい目に逢った
I have been ill-used―had hard measure dealt me.
君にはひどい目に逢わされた
You have dealt harshly by me―used me ill―used me like a dog.
君にこんなひどい目に逢わされようとは思わなかった
I did not expect such treatment at your hands.
君のためにひどい目に逢った
You have caused me great trouble.
そんなことをするとひどい目に逢わせるぞ
You shall smart for it―pay dearly for it.
競技の相手などをひどい目に逢わせる
to punish an antagonist
彼は僕にひどいことを言った
He called me hard names.
君はひどいことを言うね
You put it strong.
(人が無法なことをするのを見て)ひどいことをする
It is a shame that he should do such a thing―What a shame!―Shame!
ひどい主人だ
He is a hard master.
君はひどい人だ
You are a hard man―a cruel man―a horrible man.

content: 2. (=甚しい)gross (mistake); crass (ignorance); glaring (error); burning (shame); crying (disgrace); egregious (folly); excessive (economy); extreme(timidity); oppressive (heat); bitter (cold); vile (taste); villainous (smell); sore (need); dire (distress); execrable (roads); atrocious (insolence); outrageous (pronunciation); exorbitant (price); preposterous (demands, etc.)

content.content: ひどい誤りだけは直しておいた
I have corrected gross mistakes―glaring errors.
今日はひどい暑さだ
The heat is oppressive today.
外はひどい寒さだ
It is bitterly cold without.
表はひどい埃だ
The dust is very bad without.
ひどい道だ
The roads are execrable.
ひどい発音だ
His pronunciation is outrageous.
ひどい待遇だ
The terms are atrocious.
ひどい要求だ
The demands are preposterous.
ひどい条件だ
The condition is exorbitant.
ひどい臭気を発散する
It gives out a vile smell―a villainous stench.
彼はひどい近眼だ
He is dreadfully near-sighted.
ひどいあばただ
He is terribly pockmarked.
ひどい藪にらみだ
He squints horribly.
これはひどい恥かきだ
This is burning shame―a crying disgrace.
あれはひどいばか者だ
He is an egregious ass―He shows egregious folly―crass stupidity.
ひどい失錯をしたものだ
He has committed an egregious blunder.
ひどい無学だ
He shows crass ignorance.
その女はひどいお多福だ
She is such a fright!
恩人の悪口を言うとはひどい人だ
What a man to abuse your benefactor!

content:
ひといき〔一と息〕
〈名〉A breath

content.content: ひと息に
at a breath―at a draught―at a stretch―at a heat―at a fling―at a stroke
ひと息にやってしまう
to do anything at a breath―at a heat―at a fling―at a stroke
ひと息に十里歩いた
I did ten leagues at a heat.
ひと息に飲み干せ
Empty the glass at a draught―at one gulp.
ひと息に何時間働けるか
How many hours can you work at a stretch?
ひと息吐く
to take breath
坂の中段でひと息休んだ
We took breath―took a rest―when half-way up the slope.
(安心して)ホッとひと息吐いた
I drew a long breath―gave a sigh of relief.
今ひと息
another effort
今ひと息というところで負けた
Another effort, and I should have won the day―I lost the day by sparing the final effort.
文章は好い文章だが今ひと息というところがある
The style is a good one, but it leaves something to be desired.

ひといちばいの〔人一倍の〕
〈形〉Unusual

ひといれやど〔人入れ宿〕
〈名〉A serving-men's agency

content:
ひどう〔非道〕
〈形〉Unnatural; unjust; inhuman; iniquitous; wicked

content.content: 極悪非道
diabolic―fiendish―satanic―hellish―infernal
残忍非道
atrocious―barbarous―brutal―ruthless

content:
ひとうけ〔人請け〕
〈名〉Popularity

content.content: 彼は人請けが好い
He is popular.
彼は人請けが悪い
He is unpopular.

content:
ひとうち〔一と打ち〕
〈名〉One blow

content.content: ひと打ちで牛を打ち倒した
He felled the ox with one blow of his fist.

content:
ひとえ〔一と重〕
〈形〉Single

content.content: 一重咲きの花
a single flower
花は八重より一重が好い
I prefer single flowers to double ones.
隣りとは壁一重です
We are separated from our neighbour by a single partition-wall―There is only a partition-wall between us and our neighbour.
一重ボタンの上衣
a single-breasted coat
美人は皮一重
“Beauty is but skin-deep.”

content:
ひとえに〔偏に〕
〈副〉
1. (=ひたすら)earnestly(の意味なれどもかく訳さず)

content.content: ひとえに御容赦下され度候
I humbly beg your pardon.
御贔屓の程偏に奏願上候{ごひいきのほどひとえにねがいあげたてまつりそうろう}
We request you will honour us with your patronage―We solicit your patronage.

content: 2. (=全く)wholly; entirely

content.content: これもひとえに貴君のお蔭です
This is all owing to you.

ひとえもの〔単衣〕
〈名〉An unlined garment; a summer gown

content:
ひとおもいに〔一と思いに〕
〈副〉With one (desperate) effort

content.content: 死ぬのはひと思いだ
Death is a single pang and soon over.
(苦しいから)ひと思いに殺しておくれ
Release me from my miseries―Put me out of misery.
ひと思いに殺してやった方がお情けだ
It would be an act of mercy to put him out of misery―to put an end to his miseries―at once.
ひと思いに死んでしまおうかとまでも思った
I even thought of putting myself out of misery.
薬は苦しいがひと思いに呑んでしまえ
Swallow the bitter medicine at a gulp!

ひとかい〔人買い〕
〈名〉A slave-dealer

content:
ひとがき〔人垣〕
〈名〉A living fence

content.content: 通りの両側に人垣を築いた
The streets were lined with people.

content:
ひとかげ〔人影〕
〈名〉A form; a figure

content.content: 暗闇をすかして見ると男と女の人影が見えた
I peered into the darkness, and discerned the forms of a man and a woman.

content:
ひとかず〔人数〕
〈名〉The number of persons

content.content: 人数は
How many are there?
人数を数える
to count the men―tell noses
人数をそろえる、人数を狩り集める
to make up the number―complete the number
人数をまとめる
to make up a party

ひとかたならず〔一と方ならず〕
〈副〉Greatly; very much

content:
ひとかたならぬ〔一と方ならぬ〕
〈形〉Exceptional (kindness); exceeding (goodness); great (obligations); assiduous, sedulous (attentions)

content.content: あの方にはひとかたならぬお世話になりました
I lie under great obligations to him―(他動詞構文にすると)―He has laid me under boundless obligations.
病気中はひとかたならぬお世話になりました
You have been exceedingly good to me in my illness.
珍客に対してはひとかたならぬもてなしぶりであった
They were assiduous in their attentions to their honoured guest―They paid him sedulous attentions.

content:
ひとかど〔一と廉〕
〈形〉Able (workman); full (teacher); full-fledged (journalist); competent (fortune); sufficient (capital, etc.)

content.content: ひとかどの身代
a competent fortune―a competence
ひとかどの身代をこしらえる
to acquire a competence
これだけありゃひとかどの身代だ
It is quite a fortune.
十年経てばひとかどの資本ができる
In ten years, you will have a sufficient capital―enough to start with.
ひとかどの働き
a man's work
ひとかどの働きをする
to do a man's work―fill a man's shoes
ひとかどの働きをしないうちはひとかどの人間になったような気がしない
Unless you do a man's work, you do not feel yourself a man.
お前をひとかどの人間にしてやる
I will make a man of you.
彼はひとかどの人間になった
He is made a man of.
彼はもうひとかどの職人だ
He is an able workman.
ひとかどの先生だ
He is a full teacher.
ひとかどの新聞記者だ
He is a full-fledged journalist.
世間の娘達はまだお雛飾りをしている年頃にS婦人はひとかどの政治家であった
Madam de Stael was an able politician at an age when other girls are dressing dolls.

content:
ひとがら〔人柄〕
〈名〉Personal character; personal appearance; personality

content.content: どんな人柄か
What sort of a man is he?
人柄が好い
He is a good sort of a man―a decent sort of a chap―(容貌なら)―a good-looking man―a personable man.

content: 〈形〉Genteel; elegant

content.content: この着物の方がお人柄だ
This gown is the more elegant of the two.
意気で人柄
smart and elegant
あの子はお人柄だ
She is quite the lady.

content:
ひとからげ〔一と紮げ〕
〈名〉A lump

content.content: ひとからげにする
to lump things together
十把ひとからげに評す
to condemn in the lump―condemn in the gross―make a sweeping condemnation―make a wholesale condemnation―lump one with the others
十把ひとからげの評はご免だ
I do not like to be lumped with the others.
十把ひとからげの評
a sweeping condemnation―a wholesale condemnation

content:
ひとぎき〔人聞き〕
〈名〉Reputation

content.content: 人聞きが悪いからそんなことを言ってくれるな
Don't say such things of me, for they concern my reputation.
そんな人聞きの悪いことを言うものじゃない
You should not say such disreputable things―such scandalous things.

ひときりぼうちょう〔人斬り庖丁〕
〈名〉A sword

ひときれ〔一と切れ〕
〈名〉A piece (of bread); a slice (of fish, etc.)

content:
ひときわ〔一と際〕
〈副〉Especially; conspicuously

content.content: あの子の器量はひときわ目立つ
Her beauty stands out conspicuously.

content:
ひどく〔酷く〕
〈副〉Harshly (treated); hardly (worked); grossly (mistaken); crassly (ignorant); sorely (tried); dead (tired); excessively (frugal); extremely (shy); oppressively (hot); bitterly (cold); badly (in want of something)

content.content: 今日はひどく寒い
It is bitterly cold today.
ここは夏はひどく暑い
It is oppressively hot here in summer.
ひどく疲れた
I am dead tired―dog-tired―completely done up―ready to drop―reduced to pulp.
彼はひどく窮している
He is in sore need.
ひどく難渋している
He is in dire distress.
ひどく金に困っている
He is badly in want of money.
今度は風邪にひどくやられた
I have the cold very bad.
ドイツはひどくやられた
Germany has been severely punished.
彼は細君に死なれてひどく弱っている
He is dreadfully cut up―terribly cut up―by the death of his wife.
家はひどくこわれている
The house is in very bad repair―very much out of repair.
あの人はひどく値切る
He drives a hard bargain.
人をひどく追い使う
He will drive you hard―hold your nose to the grindstone.
彼は失敗をひどく気にしている
He takes his failure sorely to heart.
今度そんなことをしやがったらひどくやっつけてやれ
If he does it again, give it him hot (and heavy)!

content:
びとく〔美徳〕
〈名〉A grace of character; a noble trait of character:(総称すれば)mental graces; noble traits

content.content: 彼は美徳を備えている
He possesses mental graces―noble traits.

ひとくい〔人食い〕
〈名〉(人なら)a cannibal:(獣なら)a man-eater

content:
ひとくさい〔人臭い〕
〈形〉Smelling of man

content.content: 人を人臭いとも思わぬ
She makes nothing of people―She is past all sense of modesty―She is a cool lot.

content:
ひとくせ〔一と癖〕
〈名〉A (remarkable or sinister) trait of character

content.content: ひと癖ありそうな顔をしている
He has a sinister face―a sinister cast of countenance.
ひと癖ありそうな男だ
He is a sinister-looking man.

content:
ひとくだり〔一と下り〕
〈名〉A line

content.content: 三下り半
a letter of divorce

content:
ひとくち〔一と口〕
〈名〉
1. A mouthful

content.content: ひと口の食物
a mouthful of fool―a morsel of food
今日はひと口も物を食べません
I have not tasted a morsel of food today.
ひと口召し上りませんか
Won't you have a drop?
ひと口に呑んでしまうぞ
I'll swallow you at a mouthful―make a mouthful of you.
そうひと口に頬張るものでない
You should not cram all into your mouth like that.

content: 2. (=一言)a word

content.content: ひと口に言えば立派な紳士さ
In a word, he is a fine gentleman.
ひと口に(一概に)そうは言えぬ
The statement is too sweeping.
ひと口にけなす
to condemn in the gross―condemn in the lump―make a sweeping condemnation

content: 3. (=ひと株)a share

content.content: 一口お入りになりませんか
Won't you take a share?

content: 4. (=品目)an item

content.content: 一口落ちている
One item is omitted.

ひとくちばなし〔一と口噺〕
〈名〉An anecdote; a short story

content:
ひとくるめ〔一とくるめ〕
〈名〉A lump

content.content: ひとくるめにする
to lump many items together―mass many things together
ひとくるめにしていくらと見積る
They are valued in the lump―in the gross―en masse.

ひどけい〔日時計〕
〈名〉A sun-dial

content:
ひとこえ〔一と声〕
〈名〉A cry; a shout

content.content: ひと声上げる
to give a cry―give a shout
鶴のひと声
a word ex cathedra―a word from the throne
貴方がそう言って下されば鶴のひと声です
Yours is a name to conjure by―Yours is a word to conjure with―Your word is law.

content:
ひとごえ〔人声〕
〈名〉Voices

content.content: かすかに人声がする
I hear a hum of voices.

content:
ひとごころ〔人心〕
〈名〉
1. (=意識)consciousness

content.content: 人心がつく
to recover consciousness―become conscious―come to (oneself)
暫く人事不省であったが風に吹かれて人心がついた
I was unconscious for a while, but the cold air brought me to (myself).

content: 2. (=平生の心持)normal feeling

content.content: これでやっと人心がする
Now I feel quite myself―feel myself another man―feel myself a new man.

content:
ひとこと〔一と言〕
〈名〉A word

content.content: 一言も言わずに座を立って行った
He left the room without a word.
一言言えば二言返す
She repays each word with interest.

content:
ひとごと〔人事〕
〈名〉Other people's business

content.content: 君は他人ごとのように思っている
You think it is no business of yours.
これは他人ごとじゃないぜ
I tell you, the matter concerns you and me.

content:
ひとごみ〔人込み〕
〈名〉A crowd; a press; a crush

content.content: 人ごみを押し分けて通る
to push one's way through a crowd―elbow one's way through a crowd
彼に人ごみに混じって見えなくなった
He was lost in the crowd.
人ごみの場所
a crowded place

content:
ひところ〔一と頃〕
〈副〉Once

content.content: ひと頃はやった
It was once in vogue.

content:
ひとごろし〔人殺し〕
〈名〉Murder

content.content: 昨夜人殺しがあった
There was a murder last night.
人殺しをする
to commit murder―dip one's hand in blood
あの人は人殺しをしたことがある
He has killed his man―There is blood on his hand.
あれは人殺しもしかねない男だ
He is quite capable of murder.
人殺しくらいは平気だ
He is hardened to crime.
あの頃は毎日のように人殺しがあった
Murders were the order of the day.
人殺しー
Murder!
人殺の犯人
a murderer

content:
ひとさかり〔一と盛り〕
〈名〉A spell of prosperity

content.content: あの店の繁昌もひと盛りだった
The firm prospered only for a spell―flourished for a time only.
美人もひと盛り
“Beauty is a fragile good.”
ひと盛り花を咲かせる
to create a sensation

ひとさしゆび〔人差指〕
〈名〉The forefinger; the index (-finger)

content:
ひとざと〔人里〕
〈名〉The haunts of men

content.content: 人里離れたところ
The place is for from the haunts of men.

content:
ひとさらい〔人攫い〕
〈名〉(事)abduction:(人)an abductor; a kidnapper

content.content: 人さらいにさらわれる
to be abducted―be kidnapped―be carried off

content:
ひとさわがせ〔人騒がせ〕
〈名〉A false alarm

content.content: 人騒がせをする
to give a false alarm―“cry wolf”

content:
ひとしい〔等しい〕
〈形〉Equal (to a number); equivalent (to an affirmative); tantamount (to a lie); like (a mother, etc.)

content.content: 沈黙が偽りに等しき場合がある
Silence is sometimes equivalent to falsehood―tantamount to a lie.
禽獣に等しき奴だ
He is a beast-like fellow―a beastly fellow.
畜生に等しき行いだ
It is brute-kile conduct―brutish conduct.

content:
ひとしお〔一と入〕
〈副〉Still more; especially

content.content: 春は松の緑もひとしお勝って見える
Spring makes the green of the pine still more green.
吉原の富士はひとしおの眺めだ
The view of Fuji is especially fine at Yoshiwara.
さなきだに振う都にひとしおの賑わいを添えた
It added to the stir and bustle of a great city.

content:
ひとしきり〔一と仕切り〕
〈副〉For a spell; for a time

content.content: この事件がひとしきり大評判になった
The affair created a sensation for a time.
ひとしきり働いてから休もう
We will rest after working for a spell―after a spell of work.

content:
ひとしく〔等しく〕
〈副〉Equally

content.content: 彼らとても皆等しく人間だ
They are all out fellow-men.
我らは皆等しく日本人だ
We are all fellow-Japanese.

content:
ひとじち〔人質〕
〈名〉A hostage

content.content: 人質に取る
to take one as hostage―(取っておく)―hold one as hostage
人質に取られる
to be taken as hostage

content:
ひとじに〔人死に〕
〈名〉Loss of life

content.content: 鉄道椿事で人死にがあった
Was there any loss of life―Were (there) any lives lost―in the railway accident?
たくさん人死にがあった
Many lives were lost―There were many lives lost.

content:
ひとじゃく〔人尺〕
〈形〉Life-size (statue or portrait)

content.content: 木像は人尺にできている
The wooden images are as large as life.

content:
ひとずき〔人付き〕
〈名〉Affability

content.content: 人づきの好い人だ
He is an affable man.
人づきの悪い人だ
He is an unaffable man―a repulsive man.
人づきの悪い顔をしている
He has a forbidding countenance.

content:
ひとすじ〔一と筋〕
〈名〉A line

content.content: 道はひと筋だ
The road runs in a line (without a branch).
槍ひと筋の主だった
He was a samurai.
ひと筋に思いつめた
She loved him with her whole soul.
ひと筋縄では行かぬ奴だ
He is too old a bird to be caught with chaff.

ひと筋縄では行かぬ奴
ひとすじなわでわいかぬやつ

ひとすじなわでわいかぬやつ〔ひと筋縄では行かぬ奴〕
〈名〉(He is) too old a bird to be caught with chaff

ひとすじみち〔一と筋道〕
〈名〉A road without a branch; a single track

content:
ひとずれる〔人擦れる〕
〈自動〉To become sophisticated; to lose one's simplicity or modesty

content.content: あの子は人ずれている
She is sophisticated.
人ずれていない
She is unsophisticated―a simple girl―a modest girl.

ひとそろい〔一と揃い〕
〈名〉A set (of tools); a suit (of clothes, etc.)

content:
ひとだかり〔人だかり〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: ひとだち〔人立ち〕

content:
ひとだすけ〔人助け〕
〈名〉An act of mercy

content.content: そうすれば人助けになる
It would be an act of mercy to do so.

content:
ひとだち〔人達〕
〈名〉Men; people

content.content: 居合わした人達
the people present―those present

content:
ひとだち〔人立ち〕
〈名〉A crowd in the streets

content.content: 表に人立ちがある
There is a crowd out in the street.

content:
ひとだのみ〔人頼み〕
〈名〉Reliance on others

content.content: 何事に限らず人頼みをするものでない
You should not rely on others for doing anything.
人頼みをしてははかが行かない
If you rely on others, things will make no progress.

ひとたび〔一と度〕
〈副〉One time; once

ひとだま〔人魂〕
〈名〉A Jack-o'-lantern; a will-o'-the-wisp

content:
ひとたまりもなく〔一と堪まりも無く〕
〈名〉Without an attempt at resistance; at once

content.content: 地震がドンと来ると家はひとたまりも無く倒れてしまった
The violent shock brought down the house at once.

content:
ひとだより〔人頼り〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: ひとだのみ〔人頼み〕

content:
ひとちがい〔人違い〕
〈名〉A mistake of identity

content.content: 人違いをする
to mistake one man for another―take one man for another―catch the wrong man
そりゃ人違いだ
You have come to the wrong shop―Caught the wrong sow by the ear.
今度は人違いでない
I have got the right man this time―caught the right sow by the ear at last.
人違いをして背中を叩いた
I slapped the wrong man on the back.

content:
ひとつ〔一つ〕
〈名〉One:(骨牌や骸子の一つは)ace

content.content: 一つになる
to become one―grow into one―unite (into one)
今に世界は一つになる
The world will become one―become united.
世界を一つにする
to make the world into one―unite the world―unify the world

content:
〈形〉［注意］英語を標準とす。
1. One

content.content: 誤りはたった一つある
There is only one mistake.
今一つある
There is one more.
あの人は一つには勉強家だ
Four one thing, he works hard.
一つには才子、二つには金持ち
For one thing, he is clever; for another thing, he is rich.
一つには飲む、二つには打つ
For one thing, he drinks; for another thing, he gambles.
一つ二つの誤りはしかたがない
One or two mistakes can not be helped.
一つ二つの誤りはしかたがない
A mistake or two can not be helped.
皆一つ穴の狐だ
They are of a hair―of a gang.

content: 3. The same

content.content: 僕らは一つ下宿にいる
We live in the same lodging-house.
学校も一つ学校だ
We also attend the same school.
彼は一つことを幾度も幾度も繰り返す
He repeats the same thing over and over again.
始終一つことばかり言っている
He is constantly harping on the same string.

content:
4. 
〈打消〉 Not one; not a (single)

content.content: この作文に誤りが一つも無い
There is not a (single) mistake in the whole composition.
あの男は一つとして取柄が無い
There is not one good point in him.
この本を始めから終りまで読んでご覧、誤りが一つも無いから
Read through the book, and you shall not find a single mistake in it.
もう一つも残っていない
There is not one left.

content:
〈副〉
1. Each; apiece

content.content: 一ついくらですか
How much each?―How much apiece?
一つ三円です
They are three yen each―three yen apiece.

content: 2. Item

content.content: 一つ何々、一つ何々
Item. So-and-so. Item. So-and-so.
一つ召し上がれ
Won't you have a glass?
お茶を一つ召し上がれ
Will you take a cup of tea?
僕も一つやってみよう
I will have a try at it.
(好い家があるそうだから)一つ行って見よう
I will go and have a look at it.
(寒いから)一つ走ろうじゃないか
Let us have a run!
(暑いから)一つ入ろうじゃないか、一つ泳ごうじゃないか
Let us have a bathe!―have a swim!

content: 〈特例〉

content.content: 心二つに身は一つ
One can not be in two places at the same time.
何でも勉強一つだ
Diligence is everything―Everything depends on industry.
語学はやり方一つだ
In learning a language, the method is everything―Everything depends on how you go about to learn a language.
語学は熟練一つだ
Practice is the only way to learn a language.
雇人は扱い方一つだ
Everything depends on how you treat your servants―The treatment of servants is everything.
(軍隊は)訓練一つだ
Training is everything―Everything depends on training.
君の考え一つでどうでもなるのだ
Everything depends on you―It entirely depends on you.
あの人は勉強一つで成功したのだ
He has succeeded by dint of perseverance―by sheer industry.
あの相撲は力量一つで勝のだ
That wrestler wins by sheer strength.
見るもの聞くもの一つとして珍しくないものは無い
Everything I see or hear is strange to me.
あんな者と一つに見られちゃ困る
I don't like to be classed with such a fellow.

content:
ひとつおき〔一つ置き〕
〈形〉Every other; alternate:(=に) alternately

content.content: 白と黒と一つおきに並べる
Place the black and white ones alternately.
一つおきに取れ
Take every other one.

content:
ひとづかい〔人使い〕
〈名〉One's manner of working people

content.content: 人使いが荒い
He works his men hard―drives his men hard―holds their noses to the grindstone.

content:
ひとつがき〔一つ書き〕
〈名〉An item

content.content: 一つ書きにする
to state the items

content:
ひとつかみ〔一と掴み〕
〈名〉A handful

content.content: ひとつかみの米
a handful of rice
ひとつかみにするぞ
I will make a handful of you.
ひとつかみに七人捕えた
He seized seven men at one swoop.

content:
ひとっこ〔人っ子〕
〈名〉(Not) a soul

content.content: 人っ子一人通らない
Not a soul is to be seen in the streets.―The streets are deserted.

content:
ひとつこと〔一つ事〕
〈名〉The same thing

content.content: あの人は一つ事を幾度も幾度も繰り返す
He repeats the same thing over and over again.
始終一つことばかり言っている
He is constantly harping on the same string.

content:
ひとつずつ〔一つ宛〕
〈副〉One by one; one at a time

content.content: 品物を一つずつ手に取って見た
I examined the articles one by one.
一つずつ運べ
Carry one at a time.

ひとづてに〔人伝に〕
〈副〉(To send anything) by another's hand

content:
ひとつとして〔一つとして〕
〈形〉(Not) one; (not) a (single):(二重に打消せば)every

content.content: あの男は一つとして取るところが無い
He has not one good point in him.
見るもの聞くもの一つとして珍しくない物は無い
Everything I see or hear is strange to me.

content:
ひとつには〔一つには〕
〈副〉For one thing

content.content: 一つには勉強家だ
For one thing, he works hard.
一つには才子、二つには金持ち
For one thing, he is clever; for another thing, he is rich.
一つには飲む、二つには打つ
For one thing, he drinks; for another thing, he gambles.

content:
ひとつばなし〔一つ話〕
〈名〉An anecdote

content.content: 学校で一つ話になっている
It is the talk of the school.

content:
ひとつびとつ〔一つ一つ〕
〈副〉One by one

content.content: 品物を一つ一つ手に取って見た
I examined the articles one by one.

content:
ひとつぶ〔一と粒〕
〈名〉A grain

content.content: 一粒の米
a grain of rice

ひとつぶだね〔一と粒種〕
〈名〉An only child

content:
ひとつぶより〔一と粒選り〕
〈名〉The pick of the basket:(形容詞に用いれば)picked (articles)

content.content: ひと粒選りの人物
picked men

ひとづま〔人妻〕
〈名〉A married woman

content:
ひとつまみ〔一と撮み〕
〈名〉A pinch (of pepper, etc.)

content.content: 塩一つまみ
a pinch of salt

ひとつめこぞう〔一つ目小僧〕
〈名〉A one-eyed goblin

ひとで〔海盤車〕
〈名〉The starfish; the finger-fish

content:
ひとで〔人手〕
〈名〉
1. (=働き手)a hand

content.content: 人手が要る
We require many hands.
人手がかかる
It takes many hands.
人手が足らぬ
We are short of hands―short-handed.

content: 2. (=他人の手)other hands

content.content: 人手に渡った
It passed into other hands.
人手にかかった
He fell by the hand of his enemy.

content: 3. (=助力)help; assistance

content.content: 忙しい時に人手を借りる
When we are busy, we must procure help―request assistance.
人手をまたずにできる
It may be done without assistance.

content:
ひとで〔人出〕
〈名〉A turn-out; a crowd of people; a throng of pleasure-seekers

content.content: 上野はたいそうな人出だ
Ueno Park is crowded with people―thronged with pleasure-seekers.
外は人出があって賑やかだ
The streets are thronged with people―alive with people.
縁日は天気が悪かったからいつもの人出が無かった
Owing to the badness of the weather, the fair was not thronged as usual.
たいした人出だ
What a crowd!―What a turn-out!

content:
ひとでなし〔人でなし〕
〈名〉A monster (of depravity); a brute (in human shape)

content.content: この人でなしめ
You monster!
あんな人でなしはまたと見られぬ
We shall never set eyes on such a monster again.

content:
ひととおり〔一と通り〕
〈副〉Once (through the whole); from beginning to end

content.content: 書類にはひと通り目を通した
I have gone through the papers once.
事の次第をひと通りお聞き下さい
Let me tell my story from beginning to end―(普通の言い方は)―This is how it happened―(古文体にては)―The manner of it was as follows:―
事の顛末をひと通りお聞かせ下さい
Tell me how it happened.

content:
〈形〉
1. (=の) usual (course); common (care); ordinary (treatment); passing (notice); plain (English, etc.)

content.content: ひと通りの挨拶がすむと早速例の問題を出しかけた
After the usual greetings were over, I lost no time in introducing the subject in question.
簿記はひと通り習いました
I have gone through the usual course of book-keeping.
彼はひと通りの英語は心得ている
He knows plain English.
勉強さえしたらひと通りの英語は三年で修められる
If one would only work hard enough, one might master plain English in three years.
これはひと通り以上の注意を用する問題だ
The question deserves more than a passing notice.
ひと通りならぬ
unusual―uncommon―extraordinary―exceptional―excessive
ひと通りならぬ注意を要する
It requires no common care.
この子を育てるにはひと通りの苦労じゃなかった
It cost me uncommon trouble to bring up this child.
彼女の歎きはひと通りでない
Her grief is excessive.
彼の弱り方はひと通りでない
He is dreadfully cut up―terribly cut up.

content:
ひとどおり〔人通り〕
〈名〉Street traffic

content.content: この通りは人通りが多い
There is much traffic in this street―This street is much frequented.
人通りの多い町
a frequented street―a busy street
この通りは人通りが少ない
This is little traffic in this street―This street is unfrequented.
人通りの少ない町
an unfrequented street―a lonesome street
夜が更けて人通りが少ない
The night is advanced, and there are few people out in the streets.
人通りがある
The streets are alive.
四時には人通りがある
At four, the streets are stirring―the streets are astir.
人通りが無い
The streets are deserted.
夜半には人通りが絶える
The streets are deserted at midnight.

content:
ひととなり〔為人〕
〈名〉A man's nature:(副詞に用いれば)by nature

content.content: 為人学を好む
He is, by nature, a lover of knowledge.

content:
ひとなか〔人中〕
〈名〉Society; the public; the world:(=で) in company; in public

content.content: 人中へ出る
to go into society
あの人は人中へ出ない
He avoids society―keeps to himself.
人中で恥をかく
to be put to shame in company―expose one's ignorance in public
人中で恥をかくのがいやだから尋ねるわけにも行かぬ
I can't be asking questions, for it will never do to expose my ignorance.
人中で恥をかかせられる
to be insulted in public
人中でもまれる
to be buffeted by the world
人中でもまれなければ人になれぬ
One can not attain perfect manhood unless one is buffeted by the world.

ひとなかせ〔人泣かせ〕
〈名〉A cruelty to people

content:
ひとなだれ〔人なだれ〕
〈名〉A surging crowd; a tide of humanity

content.content: 人なだれ打つ
A crowd surges.
人なだれ打って流れ込んだ
The crowd surged in.
人なだれ打って入口に押し寄せた
The crowd surged toward the entrance.

content:
ひとなつこい〔人懐こい〕
〈形〉Affectionate

content.content: 人懐こい子だ
She is an affectionate girl―She will take to anybody.

content:
ひとなみ〔人波〕
〈名〉A surging crowd; a tide of humanity

content.content: 人波打つ
A crowd surges.
人波打ってなだれ込んだ
The crowd surged in.

content:
ひとなみ〔人並〕
〈名〉
1. (=普通の人)the generality of people; the common run of men; the average:(=の) decent; fair; average:(=に) like other men; like ordinary people; decently

content.content: 彼は人並に暮らせるようになった
He can now make a decent living.
腕前も人並になった
He has also acquired a fair degree of ability.
彼の学問は人並勝れている
His scholarship is above the average.
人並勝れた器量だ
She is beautiful beyond the run of women―She is of surpassing beauty―of rare beauty―of singular beauty.
彼の学問は人並はずれている
His attainments are something out of the common.
英語を知らないと人並の付合ができない
One must know English to mix with people on equal terms to get along in society.

content: 2. (=普通の人のすること)(to have) one's share (of anything)

content.content: 僕も人並に成功もしている
I have had my (share of) successes.
人並に不幸にも逢っている
I have had my (share of) losses.
彼は不幸な身とは言いながら人並に酒も飲むし人並に冗談も言う
Unfortunate as he is, he drinks his cup and laughs his laugh.
僕は人並に風邪を引いた
I have caught my cold.
僕だってたまには人並に風邪を引くよ
I catch my cold once in a while.

content:
ひとなれた〔人馴れた〕
〈形〉Used to society; easy (manner, etc.)

content.content: さすがは外交家だけにどことなく人馴れている
Like the diplomatist that he is, he has an easy manner about him.
人馴れない女だ
She has a stiff manner.

ひとにぎり〔一と握り〕
〈名〉A handful (of snow, etc.)

content:
ひとのこひとり〔人の子一人〕
〈熟語〉Not a soul

content.content: 人の子一人通らぬ
Not soul is to be seen in the streets.

ひとばしら〔人柱〕
〈名〉A human sacrifice (generally a virgin, buried alive to appease the genius of the place who impedes some works)

content:
ひとはしり〔一と走り〕
〈名〉A run

content.content: ひと走り走ろうじゃないか
Let us have a run.
ひと走り行って薬を取って来る
I will run for the medicine.
(近いから)ひと走りで行ける
You can get there at a run.

content:
ひとはだ〔人肌〕
〈名〉The temperature of the skin

content.content: 酒の燗は人肌
Sake should be warmed skin-warm.

ひとはたあげる〔一旗挙げる〕
〈自動〉To put up as a candidate; to make a name in the world

ひとはだぬぐ〔一と肌脱ぐ〕
〈熟語〉To stretch a helping hand; to give (one) a lift

ひとはなさかせる〔一花咲かせる〕
〈自動〉To make a name in the world; to create a sensation

content:
ひとばらい〔人払い〕
〈名〉Clearing a room from people:(=する) to clear the room (from people)

content.content: お人払いを願います
I wish the room to be cleared.
人払いを命じた
I desired the room to be cleared―I desired them to leave the room.

ひとはらご〔一と腹子〕
〈名〉A family of children:(鳥なら)a brood of chickens; a hatch of young:(獣なら)a litter (of pigs, etc.)

content:
ひとばん〔一と晩〕
〈名〉(=一夜)a night

content.content: ひと晩寝れば直る
A night's rest will set you right.

content: 〈副〉(=終夜)all night; all the night through

content.content: 子どもがひと晩泣いた
The child kept crying all night.

content:
ひとびと〔人々〕
〈名〉Men; people

content.content: 列席の人々
the people present―those present

content:
ひとふうかわった〔一と風変わった〕
〈形〉→『

content.content: いっぷうかわった〔一風変わった〕

content:
ひとふで〔一と筆〕
〈名〉A stroke (of the brush):(絵なら)a touch:(手紙なら)a line

content.content: ひと筆で馬を画く
to draw a horse with one stroke of the brush
一筆二筆画き入れる
to add a few touches
一筆書き送る
to drop one a line
一筆しめし参らせ候
Just a line to say...

content:
ひとまえ〔人前〕
〈名〉Company; the public:(体裁の意味に用いれば)decency; decorum

content.content: 人前で
in company―in public
人前で恥をかく
to be put to shame in company―expose one's ignorance in public
人前で恥をかくのはいやだから尋ねるわけにもいかぬ
I can't be asking questions, for it will never do to expose my ignorance in public.
人前で恥をかかせられる
to be insulted in public
人前をはばかる
to have a sense of decency―preserve one's decorum
人前をはばかって
for the sake of decency―from a sense of decency
人前をはばかって泣かずにいた
I refrained from tears for the sake of decency―from a sense of decency.
人前をはばからぬ
to have no sense of decency―have no sense of decorum
君は人前の悪いことをするじゃないか
Have you no sense of decency?―no sense of decorum?
人前をはばからず
in defiance of decorum―in the presence of company
西洋人は人前をはばからずいちゃつく
Foreigners make public demonstrations of affection in defiance of all decorum.
二人は人前をはばからずふざけちらす
They carry on in the presence of company.
人前があるからそんなことは止し給え
Do not do such a thing in the presence of company―before strangers.
人前を繕う
to save appearances
彼は人前の好いことを言っている
He says such things to save appearances.
彼らが働くのは人前ばかりだ
They work to save appearances―Theirs is eye-service.
この身形{みなり}では人前へ出られない
I am not fit to be seen―not presentable.

content:
ひとまかせ〔人任せ〕
〈名〉Leaving (anything) to others

content.content: 彼は万事人まかせだ
He leaves everything to others―leaves everything in other hands.
財政紊乱は人まかせの結果だ
His affairs are in confusion because they are in other hands.
家政の上手な女は何事も決して人まかせにせぬ
A good housewife will see to everything herself.

ひとまくもの〔一と幕物〕
〈名〉A one-act play

content:
ひとまじわり〔人交り〕
〈名〉Mixing with people; going into society

content.content: 彼は人まじわりをせぬ
He avoids society―keeps to himself.
彼らは人まじわりのできない身だ
Their social station forbids their going into society―They are cast out from society―They are outcasts.
どうか人まじわりのできるようにしてやりたいものだ
I should like to have her mix freely with people.

content:
ひとまず〔一と先ず〕
〈副〉For a time; for the present

content.content: ひとまず帰る
I am going home for a time.
ひとまず国へ帰ることにしよう
I shall go home for the present.

content:
ひとまたぎ〔一と跨ぎ〕
〈名〉A step

content.content: 学校へはひとまたぎだ
It is only a step to the school.

content:
ひとまちがい〔人間違い〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: ひとちがい〔人違い〕

content:
ひとまちがお〔人待ち顔〕
〈名〉An expectant look

content.content: 花は今は見頃で人待ち顔だ
The flowers are now at their best, and challenge our admiration.

content:
ひとまとめ〔一と纏め〕
〈名〉A lump

content.content: ひとまとめにする
to lump many items together
ひとまとめにして(貰う)、ひとまとめにして(払う)
to receive or pay in a lump
ひとまとめにして(買う)、ひとまとめにして(売る)
to buy or sell in the lump―in the gross―en masse

content:
ひとまね〔人真似〕
〈名〉Mimicry; apery:(=する)(芸としてなら)to mimic people:(虚栄心からなら)to ape one's betters; to follow the fashion

content.content: 彼は人真似が上手だ
He is a good mimic.
彼の人真似は本人そっくりそのままだ
He mimics people to a hair.
彼は人真似をして身を亡ぼした
He ruined himself by trying to ape his betters.

content:
ひとまわり〔一と廻り〕
〈名〉
1. A turn; a round

content.content: 公園をひと廻りしよう
Let us take a turn in the park.
池をひと廻りしよう
Let us walk round the pond.
医者は病家をひと廻りしてから寄ると言った
The doctor said he would look in after going his rounds.
ご馳走はひと廻りまわるだけあるか
Is there enough good cheer to go round?

content: 2. (=大きさのひと廻り)a size

content.content: ひと廻り大きい
It is a size larger.

content:
ひとみ〔瞳〕
〈名〉The pupil; the apple of the eye

content.content: 瞳の拡がる眼病がある
There is an eye-disease in which the pupil expands.
瞳をこらす
to strain one's eyes
瞳をこらしてやっと見える
You can just see it by straining your eyes.
瞳をこらして見る
to peer at anything
瞳を定める
to fix one's eyes on an object

ひとみごくう〔人身御供〕
〈名〉A human sacrifice

content:
ひとみしりする〔人見知りする〕
〈自動〉To be afraid of strangers

content.content: この子は人見知りしない
The child is not afraid of strangers―The child takes to everybody.

content:
ひとむかし〔一と昔〕
〈名〉A short age

content.content: 十年ひと昔
Ten years make a short age.
それはひと昔前のことだ
It happened an age ago.

content:
ひとめ〔一と目〕
〈名〉A glance; a glimpse

content.content: ひと目で
at a glance
ひと目見ればわかる
You can see at a glance―One glance is enough.
ひと目でそれと悟った
I grasped the situation at a glance.
ひと目見てすっかり様子がわかった
I saw all at a glance―I understood the whole story at a glance.
ひと目で彼の悪計を見破った
I saw through his design at a glance―One glance was enough for me to see through his design.
ここからは全市がひと目で見える
Here you can see the whole city at a glance.
ひと目見る
to catch a glimpse of anything
その顔をひと目見るより飛び立つ思い
No sooner did I catch a glimpse of her face, than I leaped for joy.
今ひと目見て死にたい
O for another glimpse of her before I die!

content:
ひとめ〔人目〕
〈名〉Observation; notice; attention; the public gaze

content.content: 人目を忍ぶ、人目を避ける、人目をぬすむ
to avoid observation―elude observation―shun observation
人目を忍んで、人目をぬすんで廓へ通う
He frequents gay quarters in secret―by stealth―on the sly.
二人は人目を忍んで会った
They met in secret―arranged clandestine meetings.
ほど無く二人は人目を忍ぶ仲となった
It was not long before they met in secret.
人目をはばかる、人目を恥じる
to fly the face of man
昨日は一天万乗の君、今日は人目をはばかる身
But yesterday an Emperor, he must now fly the face of man.
人目を隠す
to screen a place from the public gaze
その家は人目を隠す物が無いから明けっぱなしだ
There is nothing to screen the house from the public gaze―The house is open to the public gaze.
人目繁し
The place is open to the public gaze.
人目を引く、人目に留まる、人目にかかる、人目につく
to attract attention―draw attention―attract notice
人目にかからぬそのうちに
Let us fly before we attract notice!
人目に留らぬ
to escape notice―escape observation
人目無し(番人がいない)
The coast is clear―All clear!
人目無ければ泣きまろぶ
Left to herself, she abandons herself to her grief.
人目離れたところ
a secluded spot―a sequestered spot
人目の関
social restraint

ひどめあぶら〔火止油〕
〈名〉Safety kerosene

content:
ひともしごろ〔火ともし頃〕
〈名〉Candlelight

content.content: 火ともし頃に家に帰った
I got home at candlelight.

content:
ひとやま〔一と山〕
〈名〉A lot (of goods)

content.content: 一山いくらで売る
They are sold by the lot.
一山十銭
ten sen a lot
一山百文
sixpenny a lot
あんな奴らは一山百文だ
Such men are beneath notice―unworthy of consideration.

content:
ひとやま〔人山〕
〈名〉A crowd

content.content: 交番に人山を築いた
A crowd gathered at the police-box.

content:
ひとよ〔一と夜〕
〈名〉A night

content.content: 今宵一夜の宿を貸し給え
Can you accommodate me with a night's lodging?

content:
ひとよし〔人好し〕
〈形〉Good-natured; accommodating:(悪く言えば)soft-headed

content.content: あの人はお人好しだ
He has a soft head―a soft spot in his head.

ひとよづま〔一と夜妻〕
〈名〉A harlot

content:
ひとらしい〔人らしい〕
〈形〉Decent; respectable

content.content: 人らしく暮らしている
He leads a decent life―lives a respectable life.

content:
ひとり〔一人、独〕
〈名〉One person

content.content: 彼は生存者の一人だ
He is one of the survivors.
二人の口は過ごせるが一人の口は過ごせぬ
It costs more to keep one than two―It costs less to keep two than one.
彼は千人に一人という人だ
He is a man in a thousand.
人の子一人通らぬ
Not a soul is to be seen in the streets.
一人に一円ずつやれ
Give them one yen each―one yen apiece.
今一人入れます
There is room for one more.
十人及第して僕もその一人
Ten have passed, myself among the rest.
落第は一人も無い
No one has failed―Not a man has failed―Not a single man has failed.
成功したのは君一人だ
You are the only man Who has succeeded.
僕の友人は君一人だ
You are my only friend.
一人も残らす
every one of them―to a man―to the last man―without an exception
僕は生徒を一人も残らず知っている
I know the students, every one of them―every mother's son of them.
一人も残らず僕に反対した
They were against me to a man.
一人も残らず戦死した
Every one of them was killed―They fell fighting to the last man.
船長は一人も残さず日本人だ
The captains are Japanese, without an exception.
彼の世話をして迷惑した者は一人や二人でない
Several people have got into trouble through helping him.
独りで楽しむ
to love one's own company―love solitude
君子は独りを慎む
The true man delights in the approbation of his own heart.

content: 〈形〉(=の) one; only

content.content: 家には小さい女の子がただ一人おった
There was only one little girl in the house.
後もに先にもたった一人の子だ
He is their only child.
天にも地にも一人の君
You are everything to me.

content: 〈副〉(=で)alone:(単独に)by oneself:(独力で)for oneself:(独りでに)of oneself; spontaneously:(自ら進んで)of one's own accord; of one's own free will; voluntarily

content.content: 広い世界にただ一人
I am alone in the wide, wide world.
あの年になれば独り世の中へ出しても安心だ
At his age, you may trust him alone in the world.
(相手無しに)独りで
alone―by oneself
お独りですか
Are you all alone?―all by yourself?
独りで来ました
I have come all by myself.
彼は独り住居だ
He lives all by himself.
この子は独りで遊ぶことが好きだ
The child likes to play by itself.
仕事を(二人がかりでない)独りでしたのか
Did you do the work by yourself?
お独りでおさびしいでしょう
You must be lonely by yourself.
独りでけんかはできぬ
“It takes two to make a quarrel.”
(人にして貰わないで)独りでする
to do anything for oneself
僕は何でも独りですることが好きだ
I like to do everything for myself.
(そういちいち質問しないで)独りで考えてみるがよい
You ought to think for yourself.
独りで意味を考え出すさ
You must find out the meaning for yourself.［注意］ この場合に動詞が名詞の Object を有する時は“for oneself”を“one's own”と変ずる。例えば
船乗りは何でも独りでする、飯もひとりで焚く、着物も独りで縫う
A sailor can do everything for himself―cook his own food―make his own clothes.
早く独りで飯の食えるようにおなり
You must learn to get your own living.
彼は独りで飯が食えるようになった
He has fallen into the way of getting his own living.
この子は独りで着物をこしらえます
The girl can make her own dress.
(他からどうもされずに)独りでする
to do anything of oneself―of itself―spontaneously
君は朝(起こされずに)独りで目を覚ますか
Do you awake of yourself in the morning?
(彼を起こしはせぬ)独りで起きたのだ
I did not wake him; he woke up of himself.
(明りを消しはせぬ)独りで消えたのだ
I did not put out the light; it went out of itself.
戸が独りで明いた
The door opened of itself.
草は独りで生える
Weeds grow of themselves.
今ここへ置いた物が独りで無くなるはずがない
It is impossible that what I placed here just now, can have disappeared of itself.
天地が独りでできたというのは Herbert Spencer
Herbert Spencer says that the universe came into existence of itself―generated itself spontaneously. (Spontaneous generation―天地自然発生論)
(人に勧められず)独りでする
to do anything of one's own accord―of one's own free will―of one's own choice―voluntarily
(彼に勧めはしない)独りで金を出したのだ
He gave the money of his own accord―of his own free will.
(逃亡した小僧は)うっちゃっておくと独りで帰って来る
Let him alone, and he will return of his own accord.
この鳥は放すと独りで帰って来る
If you let the bird fly away, it will return of its own accord.
(皆行ってしまって)僕一人残った
I was left to myself.
独りで占める
to have anything to oneself
君はこの大きな部屋を独りで占領しているのか
Have you the whole room to yourself?
独り言を言う
to talk to oneself［注意］これに倣ってできる熟語は
独りで笑う
to laugh to oneself
独りでほくほくする
to chuckle to oneself
独りでうなずく
to nod to oneself
独りで本を読む
to read a book to oneself
彼は独りでしゃべっている
He engrosses the conversation.
彼は先生も校長も会計も小使いも皆一人で兼ねている
He is teacher, principal, treasurer, servant, all in one.
独りで暮らす
to continue single―remain a bachelor―live in single blessedness
僕は生涯独りで暮らすつもりだ
I will remain a bachelor through life―live and die a bachelor.
あの人は独りで承知しいる
He fancies he knows everything.
独りで決め込んでいる
He dogmatizes on everything―He is a dogmatist.
一人一人尋ねて見よう
I will ask them one by one.
一人ずつ
one by one―one at a time
一人ずつ呼んで来い
Call them one at a time.
これを為し得る者は独り彼あるのみ
He alone can do it―He is the only man that can do it.
これを為し得る者は独り彼のみではない
It is not he alone that can do it―He is not the only man that can do it.

content:
ひとり〔一人、独〕
〈名〉One person

content.content: 彼は生存者の一人だ
He is one of the survivors.
二人の口は過ごせるが一人の口は過ごせぬ
It costs more to keep one than two―It costs less to keep two than one.
彼は千人に一人という人だ
He is a man in a thousand.
人の子一人通らぬ
Not a soul is to be seen in the streets.
一人に一円ずつやれ
Give them one yen each―one yen apiece.
今一人入れます
There is room for one more.
十人及第して僕もその一人
Ten have passed, myself among the rest.
落第は一人も無い
No one has failed―Not a man has failed―Not a single man has failed.
成功したのは君一人だ
You are the only man Who has succeeded.
僕の友人は君一人だ
You are my only friend.
一人も残らす
every one of them―to a man―to the last man―without an exception
僕は生徒を一人も残らず知っている
I know the students, every one of them―every mother's son of them.
一人も残らず僕に反対した
They were against me to a man.
一人も残らず戦死した
Every one of them was killed―They fell fighting to the last man.
船長は一人も残さず日本人だ
The captains are Japanese, without an exception.
彼の世話をして迷惑した者は一人や二人でない
Several people have got into trouble through helping him.
独りで楽しむ
to love one's own company―love solitude
君子は独りを慎む
The true man delights in the approbation of his own heart.

content: 〈形〉(=の) one; only

content.content: 家には小さい女の子がただ一人おった
There was only one little girl in the house.
後もに先にもたった一人の子だ
He is their only child.
天にも地にも一人の君
You are everything to me.

content: 〈副〉(=で)alone:(単独に)by oneself:(独力で)for oneself:(独りでに)of oneself; spontaneously:(自ら進んで)of one's own accord; of one's own free will; voluntarily

content.content: 広い世界にただ一人
I am alone in the wide, wide world.
あの年になれば独り世の中へ出しても安心だ
At his age, you may trust him alone in the world.
(相手無しに)独りで
alone―by oneself
お独りですか
Are you all alone?―all by yourself?
独りで来ました
I have come all by myself.
彼は独り住居だ
He lives all by himself.
この子は独りで遊ぶことが好きだ
The child likes to play by itself.
仕事を(二人がかりでない)独りでしたのか
Did you do the work by yourself?
お独りでおさびしいでしょう
You must be lonely by yourself.
独りでけんかはできぬ
“It takes two to make a quarrel.”
(人にして貰わないで)独りでする
to do anything for oneself
僕は何でも独りですることが好きだ
I like to do everything for myself.
(そういちいち質問しないで)独りで考えてみるがよい
You ought to think for yourself.
独りで意味を考え出すさ
You must find out the meaning for yourself.［注意］ この場合に動詞が名詞の Object を有する時は“for oneself”を“one's own”と変ずる。例えば
船乗りは何でも独りでする、飯もひとりで焚く、着物も独りで縫う
A sailor can do everything for himself―cook his own food―make his own clothes.
早く独りで飯の食えるようにおなり
You must learn to get your own living.
彼は独りで飯が食えるようになった
He has fallen into the way of getting his own living.
この子は独りで着物をこしらえます
The girl can make her own dress.
(他からどうもされずに)独りでする
to do anything of oneself―of itself―spontaneously
君は朝(起こされずに)独りで目を覚ますか
Do you awake of yourself in the morning?
(彼を起こしはせぬ)独りで起きたのだ
I did not wake him; he woke up of himself.
(明りを消しはせぬ)独りで消えたのだ
I did not put out the light; it went out of itself.
戸が独りで明いた
The door opened of itself.
草は独りで生える
Weeds grow of themselves.
今ここへ置いた物が独りで無くなるはずがない
It is impossible that what I placed here just now, can have disappeared of itself.
天地が独りでできたというのは Herbert Spencer
Herbert Spencer says that the universe came into existence of itself―generated itself spontaneously. (Spontaneous generation―天地自然発生論)
(人に勧められず)独りでする
to do anything of one's own accord―of one's own free will―of one's own choice―voluntarily
(彼に勧めはしない)独りで金を出したのだ
He gave the money of his own accord―of his own free will.
(逃亡した小僧は)うっちゃっておくと独りで帰って来る
Let him alone, and he will return of his own accord.
この鳥は放すと独りで帰って来る
If you let the bird fly away, it will return of its own accord.
(皆行ってしまって)僕一人残った
I was left to myself.
独りで占める
to have anything to oneself
君はこの大きな部屋を独りで占領しているのか
Have you the whole room to yourself?
独り言を言う
to talk to oneself［注意］これに倣ってできる熟語は
独りで笑う
to laugh to oneself
独りでほくほくする
to chuckle to oneself
独りでうなずく
to nod to oneself
独りで本を読む
to read a book to oneself
彼は独りでしゃべっている
He engrosses the conversation.
彼は先生も校長も会計も小使いも皆一人で兼ねている
He is teacher, principal, treasurer, servant, all in one.
独りで暮らす
to continue single―remain a bachelor―live in single blessedness
僕は生涯独りで暮らすつもりだ
I will remain a bachelor through life―live and die a bachelor.
あの人は独りで承知しいる
He fancies he knows everything.
独りで決め込んでいる
He dogmatizes on everything―He is a dogmatist.
一人一人尋ねて見よう
I will ask them one by one.
一人ずつ
one by one―one at a time
一人ずつ呼んで来い
Call them one at a time.
これを為し得る者は独り彼あるのみ
He alone can do it―He is the only man that can do it.
これを為し得る者は独り彼のみではない
It is not he alone that can do it―He is not the only man that can do it.

content:
ひどり〔日取り〕
〈名〉The date fixed upon; the fixed date

content.content: 日取りを決める
to fix (upon) the date
十日に名古屋に着く日取りになっている
I am due to arrive―I shall arrive―in Nagoya on the 10th.

content:
ひとりあるき〔独り歩き〕
〈名〉Going about without attendance or guidance:(=する) to go about by oneself:(独立独行するの意味なら)to look out for oneself

content.content: あの子はもう一人歩きができる年だ
He is old enough to look out for himself.

content:
ひとりあんない〔独り案内〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: どくあんない〔独案内〕

content:
ひとりがてん〔独り合点〕
〈名〉Taking for granted:(=する) to take (it) for granted (that...)

content.content: 彼は万事不都合無いと独り合点している
He takes it for granted that all is well.

content:
ひとりぎめ〔独り極め、独り決め〕
〈名〉Dogmatism:(=する) to dogmatize

content.content: 彼は何でも独り決めだ
He dogmatizes on everything―He is dogmatic―He is a dogmatist.

content:
ひとりぎめ〔独り極め、独り決め〕
〈名〉Dogmatism:(=する) to dogmatize

content.content: 彼は何でも独り決めだ
He dogmatizes on everything―He is dogmatic―He is a dogmatist.

ひとりぐらし〔独り暮し〕
〈名〉Celibacy; single life; single blessedness; a solitary life:(=する) to live single; to live in single blessedness; to lead a solitary life

ひとりこ〔独り子〕
〈名〉An only child (son or daughter)

ひとりごつ〔独りごつ〕
〈自動〉To talk to oneself; to soliloquize

content:
ひとりごと〔独り言〕
〈名〉Soliloquy; talking to oneself

content.content: 独り言を言うのは狂人
A madman will talk to himself.
あの人は始終何やら独り言を言っている
He is always talking to himself―saying something to himself.
ブツブツ独り言を言っている
He mutters to himself.
「こいつ胡散な奴だな」と僕は独り言を言った、腹の中で独り言を言った
“This is a suspicious fellow,” said I to myself―thought I to myself.
僕は時々うっかり独り言を言う
I sometimes think aloud.

content:
ひとりじめ〔独り占め〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: どくせん〔独占〕

content:
ひとりずつ〔一人宛〕
〈副〉One by one; one at a time

content.content: 一人ずつ呼べ
Call one at a time.
一人ずつ顔を見たが尋ねる人はいなかった
I saw their faces one by one, but I did not see the one I sought.

ひとりずまい〔独り住居〕
〈名〉A solitary life; living by oneself:(=する) to live (all) by oneself; to lead a solitary life

content:
ひとりずもう〔独り相撲〕
〈名〉Wrestling with oneself

content.content: 独り相撲をとる
to wrestle with oneself―(相手の無いけんかの意味なら)―fight windmills
今度の選挙は独り相撲だ
The election is uncontested.

ひとりだち〔独り立ち〕
〈形〉(独立の意味なら)independent:(孤立の意味なら)solitary; isolated

content:
ひとりたび〔一人旅〕
〈名〉Travelling by oneself; a solitary journey

content.content: 一人旅はお断りです
We can not put up solitary travellers.
そのお年で一人旅なすって道中で病気でもなすったらどうなさいます
A solitary journey at your age? What if you should fall ill on the road?

content:
ひとりでに〔独り手に〕
〈副〉Of itself; spontaneously

content.content: (明かりを消しはせぬ)ひとりでに消えたのだ
I did not put out the light; it went out of itself.
戸がひとりでに明いた
The door opened of itself.
草はひとりでに生える
Weeds grow of themselves.
今ここへ置いた物がひとりでになくなるはずが無い
It is impossible that what I placed here just now, can have disappeared of itself.
天地がひとりでにできたというのは Herbert Spencer
Herbert Spencer says that the universe came into existence of itself―generated itself spontaneously. (Spontaneously generation―天地自然発生論)

ひとりてんか〔独り天下〕
〈名〉The sole master of the situation

content:
ひとりてんぐ〔独り天狗〕
〈名〉A self-conceited man; a self-satisfied man; a self-sufficient man

content.content: あの人は独り天狗だ
He is self-conceited―self-satisfied―self-sufficient.

content:
ひとりのみこみ〔独り呑み込み〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: ひとりがてん〔独り合点〕

content:
ひとりびとり〔一人一人〕
〈副〉One by one

content.content: 一人一人呼んで尋ねてみよう
I will call and ask them one by one.

content:
ひとりぶたい〔独り舞台〕
〈名〉The sole performer on the stage:(より)the sole master of the field

content.content: 団十郎の独り舞台
Danjuro used to have the stage to himself.
彼は競争者をことごとく圧倒し独り舞台た
He has crushed all his rivals, and is now the sole master of the field.
競争者が無いなら彼は独り舞台で当選した
As there was no rival candidate, he simply walked over the course.
伊藤公が死んでからは山県公の独り舞台になった
After the death of Prince Ito, Prince Yamagata was the sole master of the political world.

content:
ひとりぼっち〔独り法師〕
〈形〉Solitary

content.content: 独りぼっちになった
I am left to oneself.

content:
ひとりまえ〔一人前〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: いちにんまえ〔一人前〕

content:
ひとりみ〔一人身〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: どくしん〔独身〕

ひとりむすこ〔一人息子〕
〈名〉An only son

content:
ひとりむすめ〔一人娘〕
〈名〉An only daughter:(跡取りなら)an heiress

content.content: 一人娘だからわがままいっぱいにさしておきます
As she is my only daughter, I let her have everything her own way.
一人娘だから上げるわけには行きません
As she is an only daughter, I can not give her away.
一人娘に聟を取る
to find a husband for one's only daughter
一人娘の聟になる
to marry an heiress
一人娘に大勢と見合いをさしてこれならというので聟に合格したのが即ち彼
The heiress saw many suitors, and he was found eligible for the post of husband.

content:
ひとりもの〔独り者〕
〈名〉
1. (=独身者)an unmarried person:(男なら)a bachelor:(女なら)a maid; an old maid; a spinster

content.content: あの人は独り者だ
He is unmarried―single.

content: 2. (=独棲者)a lonely man; a lone woman; a solitary person

content.content: ここに独り者がおりますからどうぞお静かに願います
Here is a lonely individual who will resent too much billing and cooing.

ひとりよがり〔独り好がり〕
〈形〉Self-complacent

content:
ひとわざ〔人業〕
〈名〉Human work

content.content: とても人業とは思われぬ
The deed is superhuman.

content:
ひとわたり〔一と渡り〕
〈副〉Once (through the whole)

content.content: 書類はひと渡り目を通した
I have looked through the papers once.

content:
ひな〔雛〕
〈名〉
1. A chicken; a chick
2. (=雛人形)a doll

content.content: 雛の節句、雛祭り、雛飾り
the Feast of Dolls

content:
ひな〔鄙〕
〈名〉The country (as opposed to the town)

content.content: 鄙に入りて都の便りを聞く
“Go into the country to hear the news of the town.”
鄙の花
the pride of the village

content:
ひなが〔日長〕
〈名〉The longness of days

content.content: 段々日長になる
The days are growing longer.
春の日長に
on the long spring days

ひなかざり〔雛飾り〕
〈名〉Playing with dolls:(=する) to play with dolls; to dress dolls

content:
ひながた〔雛形〕
〈名〉A model; a pattern; a prescribed form

content.content: 雛形に倣ってこしらえる
to make anything after the model―on the model
願書を雛形の通り認める
to draw up an application according to the prescribed form

ひなげし〔雛芥子〕
〈名〉The corn-poppy

ひなし〔日済し〕
〈名〉Daily payment; daily instalment

ひなしがし〔日済貸し〕
〈名〉Loan of money payable by daily instalments

ひなしがね〔日済し金〕
〈名〉Money payable by daily instalments

ひなぜっく〔雛節句〕
〈名〉The Feast of Dolls

content:
ひなた〔日向〕
〈名〉
1. Sunshine; a sunny spot:(=で) in the sun

content.content: 日なたで運動するのが身体の薬だ
It does one good to take exercise in the sun.
日なたは暑いから日蔭でお遊び
It is too hot in the sun. You must play in the shade.
蒲団を日なたに干す
to air the bedclothes in the sun
濡れた着物は日なたに干してある
My wet clothes are drying in the sun.
日なたに干すのが一番好い消毒になる
Drying in the sun is the best disinfection.
あの人は蔭日なたがある
He is double-faced―double-hearted―a double-dealer―playing a double game.
蔭日なたのあるやり方
double-dealing―duplicity
蔭日なたのある勤め方
eye-service
蔭日なたのある奉公人だ
He is an eye-servant.
蔭日なたの無い奉公人だ
He is a trusty servant.
あの人は蔭日なたが無い
He is single-hearted―single-minded.
蔭日なた無く主人に仕えよ
Serve your master faithfully―Be faithful in your master's service.
蔭になり日なたになり人のために尽す
to serve a friend in every possible way―in all possible ways

ひなたくさい〔日向臭い〕
〈形〉Smelling of sweat

content:
ひなたぼっこ〔日向ぼっこ〕
〈名〉Basking in the sun:(=する) to bask in the sun; to sun oneself

content.content: 彼は壁に寄かかって日なたぼっこをしている
He is basking in the sun with his back against the wall.

ひなたみず〔日向水〕
〈名〉Water warmed by the sun

ひなどり〔雛鳥〕
〈名〉A chicken; a young bird

content:
ひなびた〔鄙びた〕
〈形〉Countrified

content.content: この辺は鄙びている
The neighbourhood has a countrified air.

ひなまつり〔雛祭〕
〈名〉The Feast of Dolls

content:
ひならず〔不日〕
〈副〉In a few days; at an early date; at no distant date; before long; shortly

content.content: 日ならず全快するでしょう
It will not be long before he gets well.

ひなわづつ〔火縄筒〕
〈名〉A matchlock

content:
ひなん〔避難〕
〈名〉Refuge, shelter, asylum (from danger or pursuit):(=する) to take refuge, seek refuge (from danger in a place of safety); to take shelter, find shelter (from persecution in a place of safety―under some one's wing); to seek asylum; to seek safety in flight; to fly (somewhere) for safety:(罪人なら)to take sanctuary, seek sanctuary (from pursuit in Koyasan, etc.)

content.content: 居留民は公使館に避難した
The residents took refuge in the legation.
震災の時地方へ避難した者が多い
Many people sought refuge from the seismic disaster in the provinces.
亡命者は日本へ避難した
The refugee found shelter in Japan―fled to Japan for safety.

content:
ひなん〔非難〕
〈名〉Blame; censure; criticism; disapproval; reprehension; condemnation; denunciation; reproach; charge:(=する) to blame (one for a fault); to censure (one for one's conduct); to disapprove of (one's step); to criticize, reprehend, condemn, denounce, find fault with (an action)

content.content: 彼の素行には非難が無い
His conduct is blameless―free from blame.
彼はなまけるだけでほかに別に非難すべき点は無い
He is quite free from blame, except for his idleness.
彼の処置には一点の非難すべきところは無い
His conduct on the occasion is above reproach.
寛大過ぎたのが非難すべきである
His over-leniency is blameworthy―blamable―culpable―reprehensible―censurable.
政府の処置には非難がある
The government's measure is censured.
非難の声が高い
It is loudly censured―openly condemned.
不公平だと言う非難がある
It is censured as partial―denounced as partial.
彼の行動は非難すべき余地がある
His conduct is open to censure.
そんなことをすると世間の非難を招く

content: 2. (=振動する)to vibrate; to thrill; to shake

That touch sends a thrill through me.
君が歩くと家中に響き渡る

content:

彼の英語は世界に響いた
His name resounded through the world―rang through the world―(は第一構文、第二構文は)―The world resounded with his name―rang with his name.

content: 2. (=振動する)to vibrate; to thrill; to shake

content.content: 沖で撃つ大砲が海岸へズシンと響く

That touch sends a thrill through me.

content: 4. (=聞こえる)to sound

content: 5. (=感ずる)to be felt; to make itself felt

content.content: 彼は非凡な人だ
He is no common being―a remarkable man―a prodigy―a phenomenon.
彼は一見して非凡な人だということがわかる
You can see at a glance that he is no common being.
彼はどこか非凡なところがある
There is something out of the common about him.

content:
ひま〔暇〕
〈名〉
1. (=閑暇)leisure; spare time; time to spare

content.content: 今お暇ですか
Are you at leisure?―Have you time to spare?
お暇ならちょっとお話したいことがある
If you are at leisure, I should like to have a word with you.
出かける暇があるかネ
Are you at leisure to go out?―Have you time to go out?
僕は暇が無い
I have no leisure―no time to spare―no time that I can call my own.
ちょっとの暇も無い
I have not a minute that I can call my own―I am pressed for time.
授業と著述で少しも暇が無い
Between teaching and writing my time is fully taken up.
これは暇な時に読む本だ
This is a book for leisure hours―for vacant hours.
あれは暇人だ
He is a man of leisure―an idler.

content: 2. (=時)time

content.content: 暇があったらお供をするのだが
If I had time, I would go with you.
暇がかかる(暇取る)
to take time
相談にだいぶ暇がかかった
The talk has taken much time.
人を捜すのに暇がかかった
It took me time to find the man.
暇をつぶす
to waste time―fritter away one's time―(わざとなら)―kill time―while away one's time―(米国にては)―put in the time
雑談に暇をつぶすな
Don't waste time in idle talk!
無駄話に暇をつぶす
to waste time in palaver
こんな本を読むのは暇つぶしだ
It is waste of time to read such books―It is not worth while to read the book.
暇つぶしに読むのだ
I read it to kill time.
遊んで暇をつぶす
to play one's time away―idle one's time away
ブラブラして暇をつぶす
to dawdle one's time away―lounge one's time away
グズグズして暇をつぶす
to dally one's time away―mope one's time away
公人は義理の暇つぶしがある
A public man has claims on his time―demands on his time.
暇をぬすむ
to snatch a moment
職務の暇をぬすんできた
I snatched a few minutes from my duties.
本職の暇を盗む
to spare time from one's business
彼は職業の暇をぬすんで読書する
He spends in reading all the time he can spare from his business.
これは本職の暇をぬすんで書いた本だ
The book was written in the intervals of my professional business.
人は忙しいと暇をぬすんで読書する
A busy man will read at odd moments.

content: 3. (=賜暇)leave of absence

content.content: 暇を貰う
to ask leave―get leave
主人に暇を貰おう
I will ask leave of my master.
暇をくれる
to give one leave
一週間お暇をいただきたい
Will you give me a week's leave?―May I have a week's leave?
三日間暇を貰った
I have three days' leave.
彼は暇を貰って国へ帰っている
He is home on leave.
彼に暇をくれて国へ返した
I have given him leave to go home.
花が今日お暇をいただきたいと申します
Hana wants to have the day to herself―have a day off.

content: 4. (=解雇)discharge from service; dismissal from service

content.content: 雇人に暇をやる、暇を出す
to discharge a servant (from one's service)―dismiss a servant (from one's service)
あの者は不都合があって暇を出しました
I have dismissed him for misconducting himself.
お前には今日限り暇をやる
I dismiss you from my service this very day.
(西洋では)一カ月の猶予で暇を出す
They give a servant a month's warning.
暇が出る
to be discharged from service―dismissed from service
あの男は主人から暇が出たそうだ
He has been discharged from his master's service, I hear.
不都合があって暇が出た
He was dismissed for misconducting himself.
主人をしくじって暇が出た
He was dismissed in disgrace.
暇を取る
to leave one's service
彼は主人から暇を取って独立に商売を始めた
He has left his master's service and set up for himself.
少し都合があってお暇をいただきとう存じます
I wish to leave your service for certain reasons.
暇を取りたい時は一カ月前に断って貰いたい
You must give me a month's notice.

content:
〈形〉
1. (=閑散)free; disengaged; at leisure

content.content: 僕は午後は暇だ
I am free―disengaged―in the afternoon.
三時から暇だ
I am free after three.
三十分経てば暇です
I shall be free―at leisure―at your service―in half an hour.
お暇ならちょっと願いたいことがある

Business is slack―dull―heavy―languid―stagnant.
商売暇かと案じられ
I am afraid her business is not doing well.

Do not waste time in idle talk.
無駄話に暇つぶしをする
to waste time in palaver
こんな本を読むのは暇つぶしだ
It is waste of time to read such books―It is not worth while to read the book.
暇つぶしに読むのだ
I read it to kill time.
遊んで暇つぶしをする
to play one's time away―idle one's time away
ブラブラして暇つぶしをする
to dawdle one's time away―lounge one's time away
グズグズして暇つぶしをする
to dally one's time away―mope one's time away

君達のような貴公子は美味に飽いているから何を食ってもうまくあるまい

content:
ひみつ〔秘密〕
〈名〉A secret; a mystery:(な事)secrecy; mystery; privacy:(=の) secret; private; privy; confidential; clandestine:(=に) secretly; in secret; in private; in confidence; with secrecy; with closed doors

content.content: 事を秘密にする、秘密に付す
to keep the matter (a) secret―preserve secrecy
事秘密を要す
The matter must be kept secret―The matter asks secrecy.
秘密を守る
to keep a secret―maintain secrecy―observe secrecy―(自分の秘密なら)―keep one's own counsel
秘密を守るという約束で聞かしてやった
I told him on a promise of secrecy.
賄賂を使って秘密を守らせる(口止めをする)
to bribe one into secrecy
秘密を誓う
to swear secrecy―vow secrecy―pledge oneself to secrecy―bind oneself to secrecy
秘密を誓わせる
to swear one to secrecy―bind one to secrecy
秘密を誓ったから言えぬ
I am sworn to secrecy―bound to secrecy―pledged to secrecy―under pledge of secrecy―under a vow of secrecy.
秘密をあばく
to disclose a secret―divulge a secret―reveal a secret
人の秘密をあばく
to betray a person―give one away
君の秘密をあばくようなことは決してせぬ
I will never betray you―never give you away.
(医者が患者の、弁護士が依頼人の)秘密をあばく
to disclose a professional secret
秘密を明かす、秘密を打ち明ける

to confide a secret to one―disclose a secret to one―divulge a secret to one―reveal a secret to one―unbosom oneself of a secret to one―unburden oneself of a secret to one―disburden oneself of a secret to one―let one into the secret
君だけに秘密を明かそう
I will confide the secret to you only.
君に明かしたい秘密がある
There is a secret of which I wish to unbosom myself to you―I wish to unburden myself of a secret to you.
彼にも秘密を明かしておく必要がある
We must let him into the secret―He must be let into the secret.
秘密を漏らす
to divulge a secret―blab a secret―let out a secret―let the cat out of the bag
うっかり秘密を漏らしてしまった
I let out the secret―blabbed the secret―blurted out the truth―in an unguarded moment.
秘密を漏らすな
Do not let the cat out of the bag!
この秘密は決して漏らさぬ
It shall remain a secret for ever.
秘密が漏れる
A secret transpires―A secret leaks out―A secret gets out―A secret oozes out.
秘密が漏れた
The secret is out―The murder is out.
人の秘密を探る
to pry into one's secrets
あの人は人の秘密を探るのが道楽だ
He takes a delight in prying into people's secrets.
彼は秘密を知っている
He is in the secret―privy to the secret.
彼は秘密を知っているから生かしておけぬ
He must die, because he knows too much.
僕は秘密を握っている
I hold the secret in my hands.
大和民族の起源は秘密に包まる
The origin of the Yamato race is involved in mystery.
秘密を明らかにする
to clear up a mystery
信書の秘密を犯す
to violate the privacy of correspondence
公然の秘密
an open secret
秘密条約
a secret treaty
秘密会議
a secret conference―a chamber council―a closed consultation
秘密会議を開く
to hold a secret conference―sit with closed doors
秘密文書
a secret despatch―a confidential despatch
秘密命令
secret orders―sealed orders
秘密会合
a secret meeting―a clandestine meeting
秘密結社
a secret society
一家の秘密
a family skeleton―a skeleton in the cupboard
秘密の鍵、秘密の解決
a key to the mystery
