empty palaver

content: 2. (=世間の評議)speculation

content.content: 結果いかんについては世間の評議とりどり
People are speculating as to the result of the affair―Speculation is rife as to the result of the affair.

content:
びょうき〔病気〕
〈名〉
1. Illness:(米国にては)sickness:(軽ければ)indisposition; ailment:(平生なら)ill health; failing health:(病症の意味なら)a disease; a malady; an evil:(一局部の病気は)a complaint; a trouble; a disorder:(専門家に言わせれば)a case:(獣の病気は)a distemper:(形容詞に用いれば)ill:(米国にては)sick;(西洋婦人の月々病気と称するのは)not well:(=する) to sicken; to suffer from an illness; to fall ill:(米国にては)to fall sick

content.content: 僕は病気だ
I am ill―(は英、米は)―I am sick.
病気で学校へ行けない
I am too ill to go to school.
胸の病気
a chest-complaint
心臓の病気
a heart-trouble
胃の病気
stomach-disorder
軽い病気
a slight illness―a slight indisposition
重い病気だ
a serious illness―a grave case
危篤な病気
a dangerous illness
生命に関する病気
a fatal disease―a fatal case
この病気は命は取らぬ
The disease is not fatal.
君の病気は何ですか
What is your complaint?―What is your trouble?―What is the matter with you?
ご病気は如何ですか
How do you find yourself?
病気になる、病気する
to fall ill―(米国にては)―fall sick―(原因が自分にあれば)―make oneself ill.
達者なうちはよいが病気でもするとたいへんだ
It is all very well while you are in health, but what if you should fall ill?
あまり勉強すると病気になるぞ
If you work too hard, you will make yourself ill―(単文にすれば)―You will work yourself ill.
雨が続くと病気になる
The long rain makes me ill.
兵士が病気になる(病兵簿に載る)
A soldier is placed on the sick-list―invalided.
病気で後送される
A soldier is invalided home.
病気に罹る
to be taken ill―be seized with an illness―be attacked with a disease―contract a disease
病気に罹って一カ月欠席した
I was taken ill―seized with an illness―and absented myself for a month.
痔という痛い病気に罹った
I was attacked with a painful disease, called piles.
彼は台湾でこの病気に罹ってきた
He contracted the disease in Formosa.
僕は病気に罹りやすい
I fall an easy prey to diseases.
病気に罹らぬ人がある
Such people are proof against diseases―immune from diseases.
平常養生すれば病気に罹らぬ
If you are careful of your health, you will escape illness―keep the doctor away.
僕は病気に罹ったことがない
I never knew illness.
病気を煩う
to suffer from an illness―be troubled with a disease―be afflicted with a disease
痔という痛い病気を煩っている
I am afflicted with a painful disease, called piles.
彼は久しくこの病気を煩っている
He has long been suffering from this disease―long been troubled with this disease.
病気が発する
A disease declares itself.
大事にしないと病気が再発するぞ
Be careful of yourself, or you will have a relapse.
彼は病気で臥している
He is ill abed―laid up with an illness―laid by the heels.
病気で引籠っております
I must keep my bed―keep my room―I am confined to my bed―confined to my room―laid by the heels.
病気中
(病気中の状態に重きを置けば)when one is ill―in one's illness―(病気中の時に重きを置けば)―while one is ill―during one's illness.
病気中世話になった
He was good to me when I was ill―in my illness.
ご病気中は誰が代理をしましたか
Who took your place while you were ill?―during your illness?
病気がよくなる、病気が治る、病気が全快する
One gets well―recovers from one's illness―recovers one's health―is restored to health.
病気全快
recovery from illness―recovery of health―restoration to health
彼は長く病気をして治ったばかりだ
He has just recovered from a long illness.
病気はもうよいか
Are you quite well now?
君の病気はじきに治る
You will soon be well.
君の病気は一週間たてば治る
You will be well in a week's time―(通例他動詞構文にして)―A week will set you up―set you right.
その病気はひと晩寝れば治る
A night's rest will set you right.
彼の病気は一カ月はかかる(一カ月たたなけりゃ治らぬ)
It will take him a month to get well―It will be a month before he is well.
この病気は長くかかる
It takes long to recover from this disease―It is a lingering disease.
病気は快方に赴く
He is on the mending hand―convalescent.
どうも病気がはかばかしくない
The invalid is not doing very well―He shows no sign of convalescence.
病気を治す
to cure a disease―(この動詞の本構文は)―cure a man of his disease
僕の病気を治して下さるか
Can you cure me of my disease?―Can you make me well?
医者が病気を治す
A doctor cures his patient.
彼はしきりに病気を治そうとしている
He is trying to get set up.
医者が病気の手当てをする
A doctor attends to his patient.
この病気は早く手当てをしないと手後れになる
The disease calls for prompt attention―The case requires prompt treatment.
病気が手後れになった
He is past cure.
病気で死ぬ
to die of a disease―die a natural death
彼は何病気で死んだか
What did he die of?
この病気で死ぬ者がある
Some people die of this disease―(医者に言わせると)―Some cases prove fatal.
病気で斃れる
to succumb to an evil―fall a prey to a disease
君はいつから病気ですか
How long have you been ill?
彼は久しく病気している
He has long been ill.
しばらく前から病気している
He has been ill for some time.
今日は病気だから学校を休もう
As I am ill, I will not go to school today―I will not go to school today, for I am ill.
病気のために欠席する

I must absent myself from school because I am ill―on account of illness―(他動詞構文にすれば)―Illness obliges me to absent myself from school―Illness prevents me from attending school―Illness prevents my attendance.
私儀本日病気に付欠席仕候依て此段御届申上候{わたくしぎほんじつびょうきにつきけっせきつかまつりそうろう、よってこのだんおとどけもうしあげそうろう}
I beg to report that illness prevents my attendance today.
病気届
a sick-report
僕は今日は病気で休んでいる
I am on the sick-list today.
病気で一カ月休んだ
I was on the sick-list for a month.
病気で一年後れた
I have played away a year.
病気のほかは決して学校を休むな
Do not absent yourself from school on any account, unless you are ill.
彼は病気で国へ帰っている(病気賜暇)
He is home on sick-leave.
病気で来られなかった
I could not come on account of illness―(を通例は他動詞構文にして)―Illness prevented me from coming―(を略して)―Illness prevented my coming.
病気をおして来る
I will come in spite of my illness―(他動詞構文にすれば)―My illness shall not prevent my coming.
僕は病気を押して試験を受けた
I sat for the examination in spite of my illness―notwithstanding my illness―(他動詞構文にすれば)―My illness did not prevent my taking the examination.
病気で外出ができない
I can not go out of doors―I must keep indoors―on account of illness―(他動詞構文にすれば)―Illness keeps me indoors.
病気で学問が後れた
I am backward in my studies on account of illness―(他動詞構文にすれば)―Illness has kept me back in my studies.
彼は病気のかどをもって辞職した
He resigned on the ground of failing health.
病気を構える
to pretend to be ill―feign illness―sham illness
彼は病気と称して面会を謝絶した
He declined to see me on the plea of illness―under plea of illness―on the pretence of illness―under pretence of illness―on the pretext of illness―under pretext of illness.
親病気の報に接した
I have received news of my father's illness.
田中が病気だそうだ聞いたか
Have you heard that Tanaka is ill?―heard of Tanaka's illness?
田中の病気はどうだか聞いたか
Have you heard about Tanaka's illness?
病気見舞をする
to ask after one's health―inquire after one's health
病気見舞いに行った
I went to inquire after his health―on a visit of inquiry―on a mission of inquiry.
ご病気はいかがですか
How do you find yourself?
病気の媒介物
a medium for the dissemination of diseases
病気の媒介をするものは主に水だ
Water is the chief medium for the dissemination of diseases.
蠅は病気の媒介をする
The fly serves as a medium for the dissemination of diseases.
あの人は病気の問屋だ
He is a storehouse of diseases.

content:
びょうぎ〔廟議〕
〈名〉A Cabinet council

content.content: 廟議決せず
The Cabinet is divided.

content:
びょうきあがり〔病気上がり〕
〈名〉Convalescence

content.content: 彼は病気上がりだ
He is in convalescence―a convalescent.
病気上がりで大磯で療養中だ
He is convalescing―recuperating―recruiting―at Oiso.

ひょうぎいん〔評議員〕
〈名〉A councillor:(財団の評議員は)a trustee

content:
ひょうぎかい〔評議会〕
〈名〉A council; a conference

content.content: この問題について評議会を開いている
A conference is sitting on the question.

content:
びょうきみまい〔病気見舞〕
〈名〉A visit of inquiry

content.content: 病気見舞をする
to ask after one's health―inquire after one's health
病気見舞に行った
I went to inquire after his health―on a visit of inquiry―on a mission of inquiry.

ひょうきん〔瓢軽〕
〈形〉Waggish, funny, droll, facetious (fellow, etc.)

content:
びょうきん〔病菌〕
〈名〉Disease-germs; epidemic bacilli

content.content: 病菌を伝播する
to disseminate disease-germs

ひょうきんもの〔瓢軽者〕
〈名〉A wag; a funny man; a droll fellow; a facetious person

content:
ひょうぐ〔表具〕
〈名〉Mounting:(=する) to mount (a picture, etc.)

content.content: この絵を表具させよう
I will have this picture mounted.
表具師
a paper-hanger

content:
びょうく〔病苦〕
〈名〉Pain; suffering

content.content: 病苦に悶えている者が多い
Many are in pain.
人体には病苦多し
Flesh is heir to many ills.

content:
びょうく〔病躯〕
〈名〉A sickly constitution

content.content: 病躯を提げて国事に尽掌した
He attended to the affairs of state in spite of his failing health.

ひょうげた〔瓢げた〕
〈形〉Waggish, funny; droll (fellow, etc.)

content:
ひょうけつ〔氷結〕
〈名〉Freezing; congelation:(=する) to congeal; to freeze

content.content: 湖水が氷結した
The lake is frozen over.
ウラジオストックは氷結している
Vladivostok is ice-bound.
氷結剤
a freezing-mixture

ひょうげもの〔瓢げ者〕
〈名〉A wag; a joker; a funny fellow; a droll fellow

ひょうげる〔瓢げる〕
〈自動〉To jest; to be funny; to be droll; to be waggish

ひょうげん〔氷原〕
〈名〉An ice-field

content:
ひょうげん〔表現〕
〈名〉Expression; manifestation:(=する) to express; to manifest

content.content: 宇宙は神意の表現である
The universe is a manifestation of the Divine mind.

content:
ひょうご〔標語〕
〈名〉A motto

content.content: 「注意周到」を僕は標語としている
“Leave nothing to chance,” is my motto.

content:
ひょうご〔評語〕
〈名〉An epithet

content.content: あの人を評する適切な評語が無い
There is no apposite epithet for that man.

content:
びょうご〔病後〕
〈名〉Convalesence:(=の) convalescent:(=に) after an illness

content.content: 病後だから無理をしてはいかん
You must not strain yourself, as you have only just recovered from an illness.
病後の人
a convalescent
病後の療養
recuperation
彼は鎌倉において病後療養中
He is recuperating―recruiting―convalescing―at Kamakura.

content:
ひょうごう〔標号〕
〈名〉A symbol; an emblem:(=する) to symbolize; to emblematize

content.content: 標号的
symbolical―emblematical

びょうこつ〔病骨〕
〈名〉A sickly constitution

content:
びょうこん〔病根〕
〈名〉The cause of a disease; the root of the evil

content.content: 病根を絶つ
to strike at the root of the evil―lay the axe to the root of the evil―effect a radical cure

content:
ひょうさつ〔標札〕
〈名〉(西洋では)a door-plate; a name-plate:(日本では)a name-tablet

content.content: 標札を掲げる
to put up a name-tablet
門に標札がある
There is a name-tablet on the door.

ひょうざん〔氷山〕
〈名〉An iceberg

content:
ひょうし〔拍子〕
〈名〉
1. (=律)rhythm; beat; measure; lilt

content.content: 拍子をとる
to beat time
足拍子をとる
to beat time with one's feet―keep time with one's feet
拍子を合わせる、 拍子が合う
to keep time with (the music, etc.)
拍子を揃えて踊る
to dance in measured time
三拍子
a concert of three instruments (a string-instrument, a wind-instrument, and a drum)
三拍子揃う
to go on all fours
飲む買う打つの三拍子揃った道楽者
He is addicted to wine, woman and dice―a notary of Bacchus, Venus and Fortune.
万事拍子好く行った
Everything has gone well.
トントン拍子に行く
to succeed with ease
拍子抜けがする
to be disappointed―look blank
知らせを聞いて拍子抜けがした
The news disappointed us―made us look blank.

content: 2. (=はずみ)chance; impulse

content.content: 彼はどうかした拍子で失敗した
He failed by some chance.
その時の拍子で何を言うかわかったものじゃない
There is no saying what he may say on the impulse of the moment―on the spur of the moment.

content: 3. (=とたん)the moment (of doing something)

content.content: 梯子段に駆け上がる拍子にすべった
I slipped when running up the stairs.
自動車をよける拍子に転んだ
I fell in dodging a motor-car.
あわてた拍子に万事を打忘れた
I forgot everything in my hurry.

content:
ひょうし〔表紙〕
〈名〉A cover

content.content: 本に表紙をつける
to cover a book
紙表紙
a paper cover
紙表紙の本
a book (bound) in paper
布表紙
a cloth cover
布表紙の本
a book (bound) in cloth
革表紙
a leather cover
革表紙の本
a book (bound) in leather

content:
ひょうし〔表示〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: ひょうじ〔表示〕

ひょうじ〔表示〕
〈名〉Indication; manifestation:(=する) to indicate; to show; to evince; to denote; to manifest

びょうし〔病死〕
〈名〉Death from disease; a natural death:(=する) to die of a disease; to die a natural death

content:
ひょうしぎ〔拍子木〕
〈名〉Wooden clappers

content.content: 拍子木を打つ
to beat clappers
拍子木を打つ音
clapping
あれは夜番の拍子木の音だ
That is the clapping of the watchman.

ひょうしつ〔氷室〕
〈名〉An ice-room; a refrigerator

びょうしつ〔病室〕
〈名〉A sick-room:(病院の病室)a ward:(寄宿舎などの病室)an infirmary:(軍艦の病室)a sick-bay

content:
ひょうしぬけ〔拍子抜け〕
〈名〉Disappointment

content.content: 拍子抜けがする
to be disappointed―look blank
本人が来ないと聞いて拍子抜けがした
The absence of the principal party disappointed us―made us look blank.

びょうしゃ〔描写〕
〈名〉Drawing; painting:(言葉の描写)depiction; delineation; description:(両者共通)portrayal:(=する) to draw; to paint:(言葉で描写する)to depict, delineate, describe (in words):(絵にしても言葉にしても)to portray

びょうしゃりつ〔病者率〕
〈名〉Morbidity

content:
ひょうじゅん〔標準〕
〈名〉A standard; a criterion; a canon; a measure; a mark; an ideal; an idea

content.content: あの人は道徳の標準が高い、道徳の標準が低い
He has a high standard of morality―a low standard of morality.
標準を定める
to fix the standard―set a standard
標準を上げる、標準を下げる
to raise the standard―lower the standard
この標準を保持するのは困難だ
It is difficult to maintain the standard.
標準に合わせる
to standardize
標準に達する
to come up to the standard―come up to the mark
標準に達せぬ
to fall short of the standard―fall short of the mark
文章の善悪は何をもって標準とするものか
What is the criterion of good style?
学問は人物の標準にはならぬ
Knowledge is no criterion of character.
国によって美人の標準が違う
Different peoples have different ideas of female beauty.
彼女の支度は嗜好の標準に適っている
She is dressed according to the canon of taste.
活力は働く力の標準である
Vitality is the measure of working power.
忍耐力は成功の標準である
Perseverance is the measure of success.
標準価格
the standard price
万国標準時
universal time―Greenwich time
標準時計
a chronometer
標準英語
the King's English
標準強度の酒精
proof-spirit

ひょうしょう〔標章〕
〈名〉A badge

content:
ひょうしょう〔表彰〕
〈名〉Publication of merit:(=する) to publish (one's merits, virtues, services, etc.)

content.content: 功労者を表彰する
to publish the names of meritorious men
表彰状
a testimonial

content:
ひょうしょう〔表象〕
〈名〉An emblem; a symbol; a type:(=する) to emblematize, be emblematical of (something); to symbolize, be symbolical of (something); to typify, be typical of (something)

content.content: 松は操の表象
The pine is the emblem of constancy―The pine emblematizes constancy―The pine is emblematical of constancy.

content:
ひょうじょう〔表情〕
〈名〉(Emotional) expression; demonstration

content.content: あの人の顔は表情に富んでいる
He has an expressive face.
あの女優は表情がうまい
She is a good expressionist.
表情的態度
a demonstrative attitude
(男女の)表情的動作(人前で見せ付けること)
demonstrative behaviour―demonstrations of affection

content:
ひょうじょう〔評定〕
〈名〉Conference; deliberation:(=する) to confer; to hold a conference; to hold a council; to deliberate (on a matter)

content.content: 評定官
a councillor
(幕府の)評定所
the supreme court
評定衆
members of the supreme court

content:
びょうしょう〔病床〕
〈名〉A sick-bed

content.content: 病床につく
to take to one's bed
病床に臥す
to lie on a bed of illness
彼は病床に臥している
He is ill abed―confined to his bed―laid up with an illness―laid on his back―laid by the heels.
妻臥病床
My wife on a bed of illness lies,
児泣餓
My child with hunger cries.
病床を離れる
to rise from a sick-bed
病人は病床を離れることができぬ
He is bedridden.
病床に侍す
to attend at a sick-bed
病床日誌
the sick-bed diary―the nurse's report

content:
びょうしょう〔病症〕
〈名〉(The nature of) the disease; the malady

content.content: 病症は何ですか
What is the disease?
病症不明
The disease is unknown.

content:
びょうじょう〔病状〕
〈名〉One's state of health; the condition of the invalid

content.content: 病状変わり無し
There is no change in the condition of the patient.
病状好し、病状悪し
The condition of the patient is better ［worse］.

content:
びょうじょく〔病褥〕
〈名〉A sick-bed

content.content: 病褥につく
to take to one's bed
彼は病褥について満一年になる
It is a full year since he took to his bed.
病褥についている
He lies on a bed of illness―He is ill abed―confined to his bed―laid up with an illness―laid on his back―laid by the heels.
長く病褥についている
He is bedridden.

content:
びょうしん〔病身〕
〈名〉(事)infirmity; weakness of constitution:(物)a sickly constitution:(人)a valetudinarian:(=の) sickly; weakly; infirm; invalid

content.content: 彼は病身だ
He has a sickly constitution―He is a valetudinarian.
病身な子ども
a sickly child―a weakly child
病身な老人
an infirm old man―an invalid old man
病身では活動ができぬ
A man with a sickly constitution can not take an active part in the business of life―Weakness of constitution is a hindrance to activity.
病身長生き
“A cracked vessel often lasts the longest.”

content:
ひょうする〔表する〕
〈名〉To express (one's gratitude); to show (one's sympathy); to offer (one's congratulations, etc.)

content.content: 感情を表す
to express one's feelings
謝意を表す
to express one's gratitude―show one's gratitude―express one's thanks
彼は目で感謝を表した
He looked his thanks.
感謝を表するために贈物をした
I made him a present in token of my gratitude.
感謝の微意を表するため
as a slight token of my gratitude
同情を表す
to show one's sympathy
皆僕の不幸に対していろいろと同情を表した
Everybody showed his sympathy for my misfortune in various ways.
同意を表す
to express one's concurrence (in an opinion)
皆同意を表して手を上げた
All showed their hands in expression of their concurrence.
祝意を表す
to offer one's congratulations―celebrate the occasion
祝意を表するために宴会を開いた
A banquet was held to celebrate the occasion―in honour of the occasion.
学校は稽古を休んで祝意を表した
The school was closed in honour of the occasion.
敬意を表す
to do one honour
皆競って珍客に敬意を表した
They strove with each other to do honour to the welcome guest.
勇士に敬意を表せ
All honour to the brave!
これを機会として閣下に深厚の敬意を表す

content.content: 法律から見れば万人平等である
All men are equal in the eyes of the law―The law is no respector of persons.
財産を三人の子どもに平等に分けた
He divided his property equally among his three children.
平等にする

Death levels all men―Death comes to all.

平等主義者
a leveller
平等無差別
equality and no discrimination

the dissemination of disease-germs
病毒は空気や水の媒介によって伝播する
Disease-germs are disseminated by the agency of air or water.
蠅は病毒を媒介する
The fly serves as a medium for the dissemination of disease-germs.

to be infected
病毒の感染
infection
病毒の潜伏期
the incubation period―the latent period

〈名〉A day-labourer

content:
びょうにん〔病人〕
〈名〉A sick person ［man or woman］:(長煩いの病人は)an invalid:(医者から見れば)a patient; a case:(集合的に言えば)the sick

content.content: 病人を治療する
to treat the sick
病人は治療中
The invalid is under (medical) treatment.
病人はどうですか(経過如何)
How is the invalid doing?
病人は経過良好
The invalid is doing well.
病人はどちらかというと悪い方だ
The invalid is worse, if anything.
僕は今日は病人だ(業を休んでいる)
I am on the sick-list today.
病人を看護する(介抱する)
to nurse the sick―tend an invalid
寝ずに病人を介抱する
to watch with an invalid―sit up with a sick man
病人の手当をする
to care for the sick―attend to the sick
医者が病人の手当てをする
A doctor attends to his patient.
看護婦が病人に付添う
A nurse attends on the patient.
一刻も早く病人の手当をしろ
You must lose no time in attending to the sick.
病人には相当の手当をさせます
I will have the sick properly cared for.
病人は早速手当をしないと手後れになる
The patient needs prompt attention.
病人はもう手後れになった
The patient is past cure.
病人は危篤だ
He is dangerously ill.
病人は今日が危ない(峠を越す所)
He passes the crisis today―He is in a critical state today.
病人は峠を越したからもう大丈夫
He has passed the crisis―turned the corner―The worst is over.
病人は全快の見込み無し(万事休す)
There is no hope for the invalid―It is all over with the invalid―It is all up with the invalid.
病人は死に瀕している
He lies at the point of death―He is dying.
瀕死の病人
a dying man
医者が病人を見放す(匙を投げる)
A doctor gives over a patient―gives up a case.
何しろ医者に見放された病人だから九死に一生を得たのだ
He was given over by his doctor―He has had a narrow escape―He has been snatched from the jaws of death.
病人はもう安心、もう大丈夫
He is out of danger.
病人はよい方だ(快方に赴く)
He is on the mending hand―convalescent.
病人は日増しに快方に赴く
He daily grows better―grows better and better every day.
病人は立って歩けるようになった
He can get about now―He has found his legs.
病人は全快した
He has recovered from his illness―He is restored to health.
冬温いと病人が多い
“A green winter makes a fat churchyard.”
たださえ悪いところへ病人までもできた
To make matters worse, one of them fell ill.

content:
ひょうばん〔評判〕
〈名〉
1. (=世評)a report; a rumour; a noise; a stir; a sensation; the talk of the town:(=する) to talk about (anything)

content.content: その人はまだ生きているという評判だ
It is rumoured―Rumour says―Rumour has it―that the man is still alive.
評判になる
to be talked about―make a stir―create a sensation―make a noise in the world―make a splash―become the talk of the town
今度の芝居は大評判だ
The new play is making a stir―creating a sensation―creating a furore―in the town.
問題の女は世間の評判になっている
The woman in question is the talk of the town.
評判は事実と判明した
The report proved true.
評判は虚説と判明した
The report turned out false.
評判は事実無根と判明した
The report proved to be unfounded.
評判から察すると彼は偉い人らしい
Judging from reports, he seems to be a great man.
評判が立つ
A rumour circulates―A rumour runs current―A rumour gets afloat―A rumour gets abroad―A rumour takes air.
その事件の評判が立った
The affair got wind―took wind.
その時彼が欠席したために死んだという評判が立った
His absence on the occasion gave rise to the rumour that he was dead.
あの銀行が破産するという評判が立っている
A rumour is current―A rumour is afloat―A rumour is abroad―A rumour is in circulation―A rumour is in the air―that the bank is going to fail.
さまざまな評判が立っている
Various rumours are current―Various rumours are afloat.
評判を立てる
to circulate a rumour―float a rumour―set a rumour afloat―give currency to a rumour

content: 2. (=善悪の評判)fame; name; repute; reputation; credit; character; opinion; public estimation; popularity:(=する) to speak (well or ill) of (a person); to report (well or ill) of (a person); to speak of (one as a scholar); to report of (one as or to be a scholar); to repute (one as or to be a scholar)

content.content: 今度の先生は学問ができるという評判だ
The new man is spoken of as a good scholar―reported of as a good scholar―reported to be a good scholar―reputed as a good scholar―reputed to be a good scholar.
駄目だという評判だ
He is spoken of as a failure―voted a failure.
彼は評判ほどの学者でない
He is not so good a scholar as he is reported to be.
彼は正直だという評判だ

He has a name for honesty―the name of being honest―a reputation for honesty―the reputation of being honest―a credit for honesty―the credit of being honest―a character for honesty―the character of being honest.
彼は正直だという評判を取った
He has established a character for honesty―gained a reputation for honesty―got the credit of being honest.
彼が評判が好い
He is well spoken of―well reported of―well reputed―He has a good reputation―a good character―a good name.
今度の先生はたいそう評判が好い
The new man is highly spoken of―spoken of in high terms.
あの学校はたいそう評判が好い
The school stands high in the public estimation.
あの先生は学生間に評判が好い
He is in favour with the students―popular with the students.
あの生徒は教員間に評判が好い
He is in good odour with the teachers.
彼は評判が悪い
He is ill spoken of―ill reported of―ill reputed―He has a bad reputation―a bad character―an ill name.
あの先生は学生間に評判が悪い
He is unpopular with the students.
あの生徒は教員間に評判が悪い
He is in bad odour with the teachers.
彼は評判ほど悪い人間じゃない
He is not so bad a man as he is reported to be―He is not so black as he is painted.
評判が好くなる
to get a good character―rise in the public estimation―rise in the opinion of the world―rise into favour.
あの学校の卒業生は近頃評判がよくなった
The graduates of that school have risen in the public estimation.
あの学校はだんだん評判が好くなる
The school is rising in the opinion of the world.
あの先生は生徒間の評判が好くなった
He has risen into favour with the students.
評判が悪くなる、評判が落ちる
to get a bad character―fall in the public estimation―fall in the opinion of the world―fall into disfavour―fall into discredit―fall into disrepute
彼はどうして評判を落としたか
How did he fall in the public estimation?―fall into discredit?―(他動詞構文にすれば)―What lowered him in the public estimation?―brought him into discredit?
世間の評判に依頼する
to live on opinion

content.content: あの男には表裏がある

a pathologist

content:

content.content: 彼は表裏反覆常無し

(敵の)兵糧を断つ

content:
〈他動〉
1. To open

content.content: 目を開く
to open one's eyes
目を大きく開け
Open your eyes wide!
目が開かれた(これまでの誤りを悟った)
My eyes are opened―The scales have fallen from my eyes.
活眼を開いて本を読め
Read with your eyes open!
活眼を開いて天下の形勢を見よ
Look around the world with open eyes!
口を開く
to open one's mouth
アーと口を開け
Open your mouth wide!―Gape!
彼は口を開かぬ(ものを言わぬ)
He never opens his mouth.
彼は口を開けば必ずぶちこわしを言う
He can not open his mouth without putting his foot in it.
胸襟を披く
to open one's heart (to another)―unbosom oneself(to another)
互いに胸襟を披いて語り合った
We opened our hearts to each other―unbosomed ourselves to each other.
門を引く、戸を開く
to open the gate―open the door
窓を開く
to open a window―let up a window
門戸を開いて外人を入れる
to open the doors to foreigners
本を開く
to open a book
百二十一ページを開いて
Open your books at page 121.
卓上に本が開いてある
A book lies open on the table.
本を一枚一枚開く
to turn over the leaves of a book
手紙を開く
to open a letter
封を開く
to break the seal―(みだりに開封するの意味なら)―tamper with the seal
封を開いた形跡がある
There are signs of the seal having been tampered with.
包みを開く
to open a package
扇子を開く
to open a fan
学校を開く
to open a school―start a school
彼は学校を開いている
He keeps a school.
店を開く
to open a shop―(米国にては)―start a store―(また一般に)―set up a business―set up in business
彼は東京に店を開いている
He keeps a shop―keeps a store―in town.
国を開く
to open up a country―civilize a country
北海道を開くのに五十年かかった
It has taken fifty years to open up Hokkaido.
場所を開く
to open up a locality
荒地を開く
to clear waste land―reclaim waste land
研究の新方面を開く
to open a new field of inquiry―break fresh ground
道を開く
to open a way―clear the track

後進のために道を開く

to pave the way for reform
血路を開く

商品の販路を開く

活路を開く

会を開く

宴会を開く
to hold a banquet―give a dinner
ご安着の祝宴を開く

舞踏会を開く
to give a ball
博覧会を開く
to hold a fair
共進会を開く
to hold a competitive exhibition
会議を開く

旗艦上に参謀会議を開いた

軍法会議を開く
to hold a court-martial
この問題について委員会を開いている
A committee is sitting on the question.
これより議事を開きます
We now proceed to business.
法廷を開く
to hold a court
公判を開く
to hear a case―The court sits on a case
明日公判を開く
The court sits on the case―The case is to be heard―tomorrow.
この事件は三度公判を開いた
The court has sat three times on the case.
知識を啓く
to open the mind―develop the intellectual faculties
砲火を開く
to open fire
戦端を開く
to open hostilities―commence hostile operations
新紀元を開く
to make a new epoch―mark a new era
これは新紀元を開く出来事だ

身を開く
to dodge
身を開いて打ち込む太刀をよける
to dodge a falling blow
端緒を開く
to pave the way for something

平方を開く

〈自動〉

開けない国

開けない世

運が開ける
Luck turns in one's favour―Fortune begins to smile upon me―Better times come.
運が開けない
Luck goes against me―Fortune frowns upon me―I am at the bottom of Fortune's wheel.

胸が開ける

熱を開ける

商品の販路が開ける

叛旗を翻す
to raise the standard of revolt―unfurl the standard of revolt

content:
ひるがえる〔翻える〕
〈自動〉
1. (=うらがえる)to turn over

content.content: 翻って善心に帰る
to turn over a new leaf
翻って敵になる
to turn one's coat―turn traitor
翻って考える
to reflect
翻って考えれば
On reflection,...

content: 3. (=ヒラヒラする)to wave, fly, float, flutter, stream (in the wind)

content.content: 日の丸が門に翻っている
The sun-flag waves over the gate.
日章旗が高く檣頭に翻っている
The national flag is flying from the mast-head.

content:
ひるね〔昼寝〕
〈名〉A nap; a siesta; a snooze:(=する) to take a nap; to take a siesta; to snooze

content.content: 昼寝をしようと思って横になった
I lay down for a nap.
昼寝をしようと思って身体を落付けた
I settled myself for a nap.
食後の昼寝
forty winks
田舎の学問は京の昼寝
Better take a nap in town than study in the country.

ひるひなか〔昼日中〕
〈副〉In broad daylight

content:
ひるま〔昼間〕
〈名〉Day; daytime:(副詞に用いれば)in the daytime; by day

content.content: 昼間働いて夜は寝る
We work in the daytime and sleep at night.
昼間寝て夜働くものがある
Some people sleep by day and work by night.

a Burmese

〈名〉Forenoon:(副詞に用いれば)in the forenoon

ひるむ〔怯む〕
〈自動〉To flinch (from a difficulty); to wince (under pain); to shrink (from a task); to falter (at the last moment); to give way (to or before superior numbers); to be daunted (by failure)

content:
ひるめし〔昼飯〕
〈名〉The midday meal; dinner; lunch; luncheon; tiffin

content.content: 昼飯を食う
to dine―cat one's dinner―take one's dinner―have one's dinner
皆昼飯を食っている
They are having their dinner―at dinner.
行って見ると昼飯の最中だった
I found them at dinner.
昼飯には何ご馳走があったか
What did you have for dinner?
牛肉で昼飯を食った
I dined on beef.
昼飯は学校で食う
I take my lunch at the school.
君の家では昼飯は何時か
What time do you dine?―What is your dinner-hour?
昼飯は十二時
We dine at 12.
君が返らないから昼飯を食わずに待っておった
We have been waiting dinner for you.
誰が帰らなくとも待たずに昼飯を食ってしまう
We wait dinner for no one.
(もう飯時だ)昼飯を食って行かないか
Won't you stay (to) dinner?

ひるやすみ〔昼休み〕
〈名〉Midday recess

content:
ひれ〔鰭〕
〈名〉A fin

content.content: 年を取ると鰭がつく
One acquires dignity with age.

content:
ひれい〔比例〕
〈名〉Proportion:(=する) to be proportioned to, be proportional to, be proportionate to, be in proportion to (something):(=的) proportional; proportionate

content.content: 賃銀は時間と比例すべし
The wages should be proportioned to―proportional to―proportionate to―in proportion to―the hours.
単比例
simple proportion
復比例
compound proportion
正比例
direct proportion
反比例
inverse proportion
速力は時間と反比例になる
The velocity is inversely proportional to the time.

ひれい〔非礼〕
〈名〉Impropriety; indecorum; breach of etiquette
